loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married with two school going children. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and clothes for the family.

Mejumaa has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby individuals and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Beto

texts.es: Don Beto, tiene 61 años de edad, esta soltero y vive con su hija en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura del cultivo de granos básicos. Ahora cultiva café  en su propio terreno. La producción la vende en el mercado de la zona.  El préstamo que solicito es por 6,000 lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café y poder mejorar la producción. Su meta es crecer en las ventas de granos de café.
texts.en:
Beto is 61 years old, is single, and lives with his daughter in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. For many years he has made a living in agriculture producing basic grains. Right now he is planting coffee on his own plot of land. He sells the product at a market in the area. 

The loan his requesting is for 6,000 lempiras and he will invest it in the purchase of fertilizers for his coffee crop so as to be able to improve the production. His goal is to increase his coffee bean sales.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Carla Patricia es una joven de 33 años Sauceña de nacimiento y de corazón, casada, madre de tres hijas las cuales están estudiando actualmente la primaria.
A pesar de haberse casado muy joven es una mujer muy responsable y dedicada a su hogar y su trabajo, la cual labora como maestra de primaria.
Lo más importante para ella es cuidar su trabajo llegando puntual con su horario de entrada, ya que es éste el que le da el pan de cada día.
Aún con las dificultades que le toca enfrentar como recorrer varios kilómetros en bicicleta para estar en el colegio demuestra ser una excelente maestra muy querida por sus pequeños alumnos.
Con el fin de obtener su título universitario de maestra está solicitando un crédito a Kiva a través de Ceprodel para poder pagarlo, ya que con su salario apenas alcanza para sus gastos del hogar.
Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le ha brindado Kiva y Ceprodel porque gracias a estos financiamientos logró culminar su carrera y hoy está por obtener su título el que mejorará su condición económica.
texts.en: Carla Patricia is 33 years old native of El Sauce. She is married and has three daughters who are currently in elementary school. Despite having married at a very young age, she is a very responsible woman who is dedicated to her home and her job as an elementary school teacher. The most important thing for her is taking care of her work, arriving on time every day, since that is how she brings home the daily bread. Despite some challenges she faces, such as riding her bike a number of kilometers to get to school, she has shown herself to be an excellent teacher who is loved by her young students. With the goal of getting her master's degree, Carla is requesting a loan through Kiva partner CEPRODEL to pay for it, since with her salary she can barely cover household expenses. She feels very grateful for the support Kiva and CEPRODEL provide because thanks to these loans she will able to earn her degree, which will improve her financial position.

loans.use: to pay for her master's degree.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, tiene 60 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene 9 años de tener la venta de productos de la canasta básica en una pulpería donde ofrece manteca, harina, azúcar, detergentes, refrescos, etc. Siendo este negocio su fuente de ingresos. Ha decidido solicitar el cuarto ciclo de préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 lempiras el cual los invertirá en la capitalización del negocio para contar con un mayor inventario y así poder ofrecer mejores productos. Comprara manteca, azúcar, harina, productos de limpieza, refrescos, etc. Su meta es la compra de más mobiliario como estantes para  ampliar el local de negocio.
texts.en:
Cristina is 60 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She has been selling basic needs products for nine years in her corner store where she offers butter, flour, sugar, detergents, sodas, etc. This business is her source of income. 

She has decided to request her fourth loan of 15,000 lempiras which she will use to invest in her business in order to have better inventory and in that way offer better products. She will buy butter, sugar, flour, cleaning products, sodas, etc. Her goal is to buy more furnishings, such as shelving, to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, butter, flour, cleaning products, and sodas to supply her business.

loans.name: Orunbu

texts.ru: Орунбу, 40 лет, замужем, имеет 2 дочерей. С 2004 года Орунбу стала заниматься животноводством. Бизнес начала с 17,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Орунбу достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Орунбу имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 3 лошади. Супруг предоставляет услуги перевозки пассажиров, а также помогает по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Орунбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и овец. Доходы от кредита Орунбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует построить новый дом.
texts.en:
Orunbu is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two daughters.  She became involved in animal husbandry in 2004, starting in this business with an initial capital of 17,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her back-breaking and capacious work, Orunbu achieved some measure of success in the development of her business and eventually started to receive a monthly profit of 8,000 som (KGS).

Orunbu now owns two dairy cows and three horses.  Her husband provides passenger transportation services and also helps her run her business.

Eager to further develop her activity, Orunbu has turned to the microfinance institution "Bai Tushum & Partners" to request a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy one cow and one sheep.

Orunbu plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount.  In the future, she would also like to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy one cow and one sheep.

loans.name: Félix Amanda

texts.es:
Félix Amanda tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en el municipio de El Sauce desde que nació, es una mujer luchadora con buenos principios morales que se dedica a laborar como maestra de educación primaria.
Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta profesión la cual le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y preparar a sus hijos los cuales están estudiando actualmente en la universidad.
Uno de sus grandes sueños es ver a sus cuatro hijos trabajando bien como profesionales para que se defiendan en la vida, por tal motivo se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un financiamiento con fondos Kiva para pagar los gastos universitarios de sus hijos y que en un futuro esto no sea un obstáculo para que ellos culminen su carrera.
Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que ha obtenido en estos años de parte de Ceprodel y Kiva, ya que sin la ayuda de estos financiamientos no se podrían llevar a cabo muchos sueños por los bajos salarios que ganan los maestros que solamente alcanza para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Félix Amanda is 43 years old and she lives in the municipality of El Sauce where she was born. She is a tenacious woman with good moral principles. She makes a living as a primary school teacher. She has been in this profession for many years which has allowed her to improve the conditions of her home and equip her children who are currently studying at the university. 

One of her biggest dreams is to see her four children become good working professionals so that they make it in life. That is why she came to Ceprodel to request a loan with funds from Kiva to be able to pay her children's university expenses and so that in the future this will not be an obstacle for them in completing their degrees.

She is very grateful for the support she has received over the years from Ceprodel and Kiva. Without the help of these loans she would not have been able to carry out many of her dreams due to the low salary that teachers make that is just enough to survive.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Cyntia Gioconda

texts.es: Cyntia, es una joven de 24 años de edad, soltera labora para una zona franca como responsable de accesorios, también estudia la carrera de Lic. en Administración de Empresas. Cyntia ha encontrado obstáculos como problemas de salud, pero ha logrado vencer las dificultades y busca la manera de salir adelante con sus estudios. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera, con el que tiene la esperanza de mejorar su curriculum para tener una mejor oportunidad de empleo, con el que pueda apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Cyntia, is young woman of 24. She is single and works in free trade zone as head of accessories. She is also studying for a degree in Business Administration. Cyntia has encountered obstacles such as health problems, but she has been able to overcome those difficulties and has found a way to get ahead in her studies. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for the degree course in her major. With this she hopes to improve her resume in order to have better job opportunities so she can support her family.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Sayrabu

texts.ru: Сайрабу, 45 лет, замужем, имеет 1 сына. С 1998 года стала заниматься животноводством. Бизнес начала с 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Сайрабу достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10 000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Сайрабу имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. По хозяйству помогают супруг и сын. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайрабу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и овец. Доходы от кредита Сайрабу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует купить автомашину.
texts.en:
Sayrabu is 45 years old, married, and the mother of one son. She became involved in animal husbandry in 1998, starting in this business with an initial capital of 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her back-breaking and capacious work, she has achieved some measure of success in her business and is now making a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS).

Sayrabu now owns three dairy cows and one horse. Her husband and her son help her run her business.

Eager to further develop her activity, Sayrabu has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" to request a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use her loan to buy one cow and one sheep.

Sayrabu plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount. In the future, she would also like to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy one cow and one sheep.

loans.name: Elizabeth María

texts.es:
La Señora Elizabeth está realizando su sexto crédito a lado de sus amigas del grupo de crédito Damas del Futuro, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque le permite ingresar capital a su negocio. Viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde 1999, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Elizabeth tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión.

Doña Elizabeth es comerciante,  se dedica a la venta de una gran variedad de ropa, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres y tiene su negocio desde hace algunos años, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de ropa. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is attaining her sixth loan alongside her friends in the credit group Damas del Futuro [Ladies of the Future]. She likes this form of credit because it allows her to deposit capital into her business. 

They live on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is renowned for its architectural beauty, has been a cultural World Heritage site since 1999, and has various places to enjoy nature. Its people are friendly and gentle, and they still maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Elizabeth is 28 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 3. Her first son is studying in a school in the city. Her husband works as a truck driver.

Elizabeth is a merchant, selling a wide variety of clothing. She learned to do this from her parents, and has had her business for some years. She also sells cosmetics by catalog. 

She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of clothing. 

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Jyrgal

texts.ru: Жыргал, 48 лет, замужем, имеет 2 сыновей. С 1993 года стала заниматься животноводством. Бизнес начала с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Жыргал достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10 000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Жыргал имеется: 2 дойные коровы, и овцы. По хозяйству помогают супруг и сыновья. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыргал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Жыргал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует купить автомашину.
texts.en:
Jyrgal is 48 years old, married, and the mother of two sons. She became involved in animal husbandry in 1993, starting in this business with an initial capital of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her back-breaking and capacious work, she has achieved some measure of success in her business and is now making a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS).

Jyrgal now owns two dairy cows and some sheep. Her husband and her sons help her run her business.

Eager to further develop her activity, Jyrgal has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" to request a loan of 20,000 som (KGS). She will use her loan to buy one sheep.

Jyrgal plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount. In the future, she is also planning to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy one sheep.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es: Magno tiene 21 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres. Magno apoya a sus padres en sus actividades agrícolas produciendo cacao orgánico y otros productos rentables de su zona. Tras optar por independizarse fue contratado como trabajador en un proyecto zonal por parte de una entidad privada encargada de realizar un mantenimiento general a las carreteras que surcan su comunidad. Considera que es un trabajo muy abnegado ya que al igual que otros jóvenes como el logran obtener buenos ingresos realizando trabajos de limpieza de carreteras, deshierbes y otros que implican apoyar al desempeño del mantenimiento. Uno de los principales inconvenientes que posee es que su centro de labores está ubicado muy lejos de su localidad lo cual le genera gastos de movilidad, por eso desea comprarse una moto para que pueda desplazarse en menos tiempo y sin inconvenientes. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevo soles y junto a sus ahorros comprar una moto para que pueda transportarse desde su centro de labores hasta su comunidad.
texts.en: Magno, 21 years old, is single and has no children. He lives with his parents, whom he helps grow organic cacao and other profitable produce from the area. After deciding to become independent, he was hired as a worker by a private company in charge of a regional road maintenance project. Magno feels that this project really helps the community, and says that he, like many other youths from the area, earn a decent income cleaning roads, weeding pathways, and doing other tasks that help with maintenance. The main drawback to this job is that it is located very far from his home, which means very high transportation costs. Thus, Magno wishes to purchase a motorcycle in order to cut down on his travelling time and enjoy a more convenient commute. This is his first loan with Kiva and he is very grateful for the financial support, which enables him to improve his lot in life. He promises to be punctual in his repayments. He asks for 1,000 soles to use, together with his savings, to buy a motorcycle to commute to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: María Flora

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañada y madre de dos hijos. Desde hace 14 años trabaja haciendo los oficios varios de una familia en donde le pagan $140.00 mensuales


Esta solicitando el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar materiales y construir un muro de retención; ya que vive a la orilla de una quebrada y el terreno se le esta lavando.

Con la inversión, le quitara el peligro a su familia;  ya que si no construye el muro en poco tiempo su casa se puede ir al precipicio y tendrá mas espacio como para hacerle mejoras a la casa y pues su familia estará más cómoda

Su deseo es, que sus hijos sean profesionales les piensa apoyar en sus estudios
texts.en:
María is 32 years old; she is in a relationship and has two children. She has been working as a housekeeper for a family for fourteen years; she gets paid $140 monthly. She is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy materials and build a retaining wall, since she lives by the river and the land is collapsing.

With this investment, she will keep her family away from danger. If she does not build this wall, her house could soon fall down. She will also have more space at home for her family’s comfort and the opportunity to make some improvements.

Her dream is to see her children become professionals. She will support their studies.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a retaining wall and protect her house.

loans.name: Upol

texts.ru: Упол, 56 лет, замужем, имеет 2 сыновей. С 1998 года стала заниматься животноводством. Бизнес начала с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Упол достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Упол имеется: 3 дойные коровы. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Упол обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы. Доходы от кредита Упол планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует купить квартиру.
texts.en: Upol is 56 years old, she is married and has two sons. Since 1998 she has been doing animal husbandry. She started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard labor and capacious work Upol has achieved small success in building her business and began to receive a monthly income in the amount of 5,000 som. Today she has three milk cows. Her spouse and children help her in the business. With the goal to further grow her business Upol has come to the Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount 50,000 KGS to buy one cow. Upol plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock in her business and also plans to buy an apartment in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Nor- Armavir village of Armavir region with her two sons and husband. She is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at a local school. Her son is a taxi driver, and together with his mother, supports the family financially. Unfortunately, the unemployment rate in the region is very high and it is very difficult for Mariam's elder son and husband to find a job. So, in order to tackle the financial difficulties, this family got engaged in agriculture. Particularly, they own a plot of land where different types of fruits and vegetables are grown (peach, apricot, cherry, plum, apple and watermelon). The gathered harvest is sold locally and family is able to cover its daily costs. Now, in order to enlarge their farming business, Mariam and her family are asking for a loan. They will use this loan to purchase two oxen, a sow, and fertilizer for land cultivation. The loan is very important for them because by getting involved in cattle breeding, they will be able to get more agricultural products, which will increase their income. Mariam and her family wait for your support.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, a sow, and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Haoulatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé Mai 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Haoulatou (assise à droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 garçons. En plus de son activité d’achat et de vente de tissus teintés à crédit par deux échéances. Elle tient dans sa maison un four pour la production de pain traditionnel, elle emploie trois personnes pour cette activité.
 
Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter 05 sacs de farine à 22 000 F CFA le sac, des améliorants et les autres produits pour la production du pain.

Les  bénéfices de son activité sont utilisés en partie pour renforcer son épargne d’une part et d’autre part à soutenir son mari dans les charges de réfection de la maison
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in this "banc villageois", which was created in May of 2010. They all live in the same district and get along well. They are primarily small retailers.

Haoulatou (sitting on the right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of 3 boys. As well as having a business buying and selling dyed fabrics, for which she has already completed 2 loan cycles, she has a traditional bread-making oven in her home and employs 3 people to make bread. She will use this loan to buy 5 bags of flour at 22 000 francs per bag, yeast and other ingredients used in bread-making. Part of her profits are used to build her savings and the other part are used to support her husband with the cost of the house repairs.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of flour, yeast and other ingredients used in bread-making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more stock such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergents for her retail shop.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à   FASSOUMBOUGOU, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mme DIARATOU assise au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir 0,5. La production est vendue au niveau du village  et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi II group are married women with an average age of 37 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Fassoumbougou, one of the villages in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th loan from the institution. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Diaratou, sitting in the middle of the picture, grows corn. She plans to use her loan to pay the labourers and buy the fertilizer needed for the cultivation of half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 105 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour wages and buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married and 58 years old; he supports two members of his family. All of his children are adults and are independent. He practices horticulture in his farm and has been in operation for a period of over 10 years and earns an income of KES 25,000 monthly.

He is now servicing his sixth loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase more farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds ready for planting among other items. The profits he earns will be used to till more land and raise more horticulture crops in his farm.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Assanaw's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Mai 2010. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Assanaw (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants (03 garçons et 02 filles), elle prend en charge aussi deux de ses neveux. Son activité s’inscrit dans l’achat et la vente de graines d’arachide. Elle achète le sac d’arachide non décortiqué, elle procède au décorticage puis la revend par pot d’un kilo. 

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’acheter au moins 08 sacs d’arachide non décortiqué au prix maximum de 8 000 F CFA le sac.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’acheter quelles que feuilles de Zinc pour aider son mari dans la finition de leur maison.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in this "banc villageois", which was created in May of 2010. They all live in the same district and get along well. They are primarily small retailers.

Assanaw (sitting on the far right and raising her hand) is the featured borrower. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of 5 children (3 boys and 2 girls) and is also taking care of 2 of her nephews. She buys and sells groundnuts. She buys bags of unshelled groundnuts, shells them and resells them in 1-kilo pots. She plans to use this loan to buy at least 8 bags of unshelled groundnuts at a maximum price of 8 000 francs per bag. The profits generated by her business will allow her to buy a few sheets of zinc so that she can help her husband to finish off their house.

loans.use: to buy 8 bags of unshelled groundnuts.

loans.name: Arben

texts.en:
Arben is a 41-year-old Roma man who lives in a main city in southeastern Albania; he has been collecting/selling and transporting scrap metal/plastic for cash to some metallurgical complex for the past two years. He has been doing this since he came back from Greece where he had immigrated some years ago. Arben is married and has two children who are thirteen and fourteen years old.  Both of his children go to school. “Many kids from my community don’t go to school; however, mine do and I am happy for this. Neither I nor my wife went to school, so we are somehow bitter about the fact that we weren’t given the opportunity then. Now, there are plenty of opportunities for our community and our children,” Arben said during his interview.
Arben is requesting a loan for the first time; he wants to buy some furniture with it. Kindly note that Arben is being photographed next to the van that he uses to transport the scrap; we thought that it would not be appropriate to take a snap of him collecting scrap.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman who has three children. Two of her children go to school, while the youngest is under age. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanahamisi has operated a charcoal selling business for seven months, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. For the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is a hard working woman who is working to ensure she provides the basics for her family. She appreciates the previous loan that helped her to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring work. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of KES 50,000 to buy threads, needles, and more cloth materials for use in her tailoring work. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support given.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles and more cloth materials for use in her tailoring work.

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven, emprendedor de 26 años de edad, esta casado y tiene un hijo.  Aprendió el oficio de carpintería trabajando con su tío, ahora quiere hacer sus propios trabajos, por eso quiere tener sus propio equipo, aprendió a trabajar en este oficio desde hace 13 años.
También se dedica a trabajar la tierra cultivando maíz y además a la crianza de cerdos para su posterior venta. Compra sus insumos y materiales en la ciudad, que se encuentra a una distancia de 3km, y los traslada en el bus.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para la compra de una bomba achicadora, ya que él cultiva en verano de regadío, también utilizara parte del préstamo para comprar herramientas para trabajos de carpintería (sepillo eléctrico, torno, entre otros.)
Con la inversión pretende, disponer de capital para comprar equipo de riego para su cultivo y herramientas que necesita para sus trabajos de carpintería, estas dos actividades (agricultura y carpintería) son sus medios de sustento para él y su familia.
Él Quiere tener los recursos suficientes para mantener a su familia y retomar los estudios, ya que solo pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato. Y quiere estudiar y ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Carlos, 26, is a young entrepreneur who is married and has a son.  He learned the carpentry business by working with his uncle and now he wants to do his own jobs and have his own equipment.  He has been working in the business for 13 years. 

He also grows corn and raises pigs to sell.  He buys supplies and materials in the city which is three kilometers away and he travels there by bus.

The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy a draining pump as he cultivates during irrigable summer time.  He will also use the loan to buy work tools for his carpentry business (electric brush, lathe, etc.)

Through the investment Carlos hopes to have the capital to buy irrigation equipment for his crops and tools for his carpentry work.  Both these businesses are the means of income for him and his family.

Caarlos wants to have enough resources to support his family and go back to school because he only finished high school.  He wants to study to become a professional.

loans.use: To buy a drain pump because he cultivates during irrigable summer time.  He will also buy work tools for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 28-year-old man. He is married and has two children who both go to school. Emmanuel is a cattle keeper. He buys calves, lets them grow and sells them later on. This is referred to as "cattle fattening." He works for seven days-a-week and 12 hours each day. He also has coffee plantations. He began the business of cattle keeping because he found it suitable. He will use the loan to buy animal drugs and coffee fertilizer. His dream is to have a big coffee plantation. His challenge is changes in climate. He is a hard working man.

loans.use: To buy animal drugs and coffee fertilizer.

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en: Ndue is a 48-year-old married man and a father of three school-going children from the northeastern Albania. He has been running an animal husbandry activity with his wife for the past thirteen years. "My contribution to this activity has been on and off because I immigrated to neighboring countries for eleven years while my wife continued with the activity. However, now I am back for good, and my entire focus is on this activity as the main source of income for our family,” said Ndue. Ndue now wants to repair the stable with this loan.

loans.use: To repair the animal stable.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 51-year-old man; he has six children aged between 12 and 24 years old. All of his children are still in school. The eldest child is in university, and Francis wants this loan to pay his tuition fees. Francis has a drug shop and his customers are mainly the people who stay within his community. His dream is to be able to pay the tuition for all his children so that they can complete school. His challenge is high taxes on the drugs. He is hard working and he hopes to have continuous access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To pay the school fees for his eldest child who is in university.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is married and has four children. They all go to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past three years, she has operated a motorcycle business. She faces a major challenge of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. She dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself. With the loan of KES 100,000, she wants to purchase a new motor bike. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor bike.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
José tiene 46 años de edad, esta acompañado y ha procreado tres hijos. Aprendió junto con sus 4 hermanos, trabajando con su papá desde los 13 años, el cultivo de maíz y maicillo. Su familia se dedica netamente a la agricultura, de ahí obtienen su alimento diario, y logran tener un excedente que lo vende para comprar otras cosas necesarias para su familia.
Compra sus insumos en una ciudad ubicada  a 10 Km. de su casa, los traslada pagando un carro, le cobran de $5 dólares por viaje, también paga para llevar el fertilizante a su milpa ya que esta un poco retirado de su casa.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas, para cultivar 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y maicillo, ya que tiene mejor precio que el maíz, por eso se ha decidido a cultivar más maicillo que maíz. Asi, contara con el capital de trabajo para desarrollar su cultivo de maicillo y aprovechar el tiempo de siembra (lluvias). Para  al final del ciclo productivo vender la  cosecha para obtener ingresos que le permitan suplir sus necesidades básicas de la familia.
Sueña con poder tener su bomba de riego para cultivar en la época seca, además de granos básicos, cultivar hortalizas que se dan en la zona, pero que por no contar con sistema de riego no las cultiva.
texts.en:
José, 46, lives with his common-law wife and three children.  He and his four siblings learned farming from their father.  José has been growing corn and sorghum for 13 years.  His family basically works in agriculture and obtains their daily food from their work.  They sell the surplus to buy other necessities for the family.

José buys supplies in the city which is ten kilometers from home.  He travels by car and pays $5.00 per trip.  He also pays to transport fertilizer to his cropland which is a bit far from his house.
  
The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to plant 10,500 square meters of corn and sorghum.  Since sorghum commands a better price than corn, he has decided to grow more sorghum.  The loan will allow him to have the working capital to grow sorghum and take advantage of the rainy season.  At harvest time he hopes to increase he income to cover the basic needs of the family.

His goal is to have an irrigation pump to grow crops in dry season.  In addition to basic grains, he would grow vegetables, but he cannot do so until he has the irrigation equipment.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to plant 10,500 square meters of corn and sorghum.  The sorghum commands a better price than the corn so he wants to grow more sorghum.

loans.name: José Ádan

texts.es:
José tiene 67 años de edad, es divorciado y procreo 9 hijos. Se crió con el esposo de una tía, con él aprendió a trabajar la agricultura y cuando tiene un poco de dinero compra ganado para engordarlo y venderlo a mejor precio.
Él cultiva diversificado: Cultiva maíz, maicillo, ajonjolí .para asegurar que al final del año  tener granos para la alimentación de su familia y vender los excedentes de la cosecha. Compra sus insumos en la ciudad, donde tiene que trasladarlos en camión o en bus. Este servicio lo tiene que pagar.
El  préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas, semilla; para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, ya que la que sembró a inicios de la época lluviosa, la plaga se la consumió, teniendo que volver a cultivar esperando que esta vez pueda tener éxito con su cultivo.
El propósito de la aversión, es contar con el sustento de su familia al final del ciclo productivo y posiblemente excedentes que le generen ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones básicas.
Su deseo es ser dueño de su propio terreno para cultivar; sin tener que estar alquilando cada año a otras personas, que al final la ganancia del cultivo queda en manos de los arrendadores de tierra.
texts.en:
José, 67, is divorced and has nine children.  He was raised byhis aunt's husband who taught him about agriculture.  When he has a little money he buys livestock to fatten and sell at the best price.

He grows different crops such as corn, sorghum and sesame to make sure that at year end there is enough food for his family.  He sells any surplus.  He buys supplies in the city where he goes by truck or bus, having to pay for the transportation.  The loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides and seeds to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.  He planted corn at the beginning of the rainsy season but it was consumed by plague so he has to plant again to get a successful crop.

The reason for the investment is to be able to support the family at the end of the productive cycle with surplus to generate enough income to improve their basic conditions.

His goal is to own his cropland and not have to rent it every year from someone, as the profit from the crop stays in the hands of the land owners.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticids and seeds to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Epiphania

texts.en:
Epiphania is a 29-year-old woman from the Bugesera district in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Epiphania started selling lights in July 2012, and she has sold 200 lights to date, providing clean energy to 1,000 people. 

She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself, her husband, Jean, and their four children.

loans.use: to buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon has operated a water-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is competition. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more water pipes for use in water distribution to her clients. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase more water pipes for use in water distribution to her clients.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline appreciates the loan she got from Kiva and Yehu that enabled her to restock her fish business and get more profit to open a vegetable stall. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase vegetables, fruits, potatoes, and onions for her vegetable stall. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, potatoes, and onions for her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma operates a fruit and vegetable-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other sellers. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables at wholesale and resell at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards. She appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables at wholesale and resell at a profit.

loans.name: Lloni Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, a sus 28 años de edad es casado y tiene un hijo de 1 año. Por necesidad y por la falta de oportunidades laborales, decidió iniciar su propio negocio, elaborando y comercializando maní en diferentes presentaciones como caramelizado, salado, dulce; aprendió a realizar la actividad de forma empírica y la realiza desde su lugar de residencia  y cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá y su esposa; de esta manera consigue los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Fernando es un hombre juicioso, trabajador, responsable y apasionado por su familia y su labor, por ello siempre quiere encontrar opciones que le permitan salir adelante junto a ellos; esto lo motivó para solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (quemador y pipeta de gas grande) y materia prima al por mayor (maní, sal y azúcar) para aprovechar los descuentos que le brindan por pago de contado; con esto tendrá la posibilidad de continuar con su negocio, tener mayor nivel de competitividad ofreciendo un producto de muy buena calidad a sus clientes y así, incrementar sus ingresos por ventas; además podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño que es posicionar el producto en el mercado y ampliar el negocio para ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a otras personas, con lo cual podrá mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida que le ofrece a su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando, 28, is married and has a one-year-old son.  Out of necessity and due to a lack of work opportunities, he decided to establish his own business making and selling all kinds of peanuts: caramelized, savory and sweet.  He learned on his own and works at home with support from his mother and wife.  Through his business he is able to earn enough income to support his household on a daily basis.

Fernando is a wise, hard-working, responsible, man who is passionate about his family and his work.  He is always looking for the best way to get ahead.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy fixed assets (a burner and large gas pipette) and raw material wholesale (peanuts, salt and sugar) to take advantage of the cash discounts.  This will allow him to continue his business and be more competitive on the market by offering good quality.  He will also increase his sales and advance toward his goal of positioning his product on the market.  He would like to offer employment opportunities to other people and improve his and his family's well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fixed assets (burner and large gas pipette) and raw materials wholesale (peanuts, salt and sugar).

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke wants to build a stable for her animals and this is where this loan will be invested. The reason for this loan is that her current stable (as you can see in the photo) is not very stable, according to Pashke.

“The animals suffer from the cold and hot weather in this poorly built stable and I do not want my animals to go through this any longer," she says. "I am so grateful to be given the opportunity to apply for a start-up loan with lower interest rates and admin fees. Otherwise, I would not be eligible for any other loans."

Pashke is a married mother of three school-aged children. She and her family live in the rural northwest part of the country.

loans.use: to build a stable for her animals.

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en:
Qamile is planning to open a little bar and café in the village where she and her family reside. A married mother of four school-aged children, she suffers from a so-called "invisible disability." 

“I am not able to do any physical work, and since this type of activity doesn’t require any physical labor, I thought it would be good for me to run this business instead of relying on governmental disability income," she says. "I can earn my own income through this opportunity. This will be a little village bar and cafe, so there is no need for fancy staff. It will serve the villagers who want to get together face to face and have a cup of coffee or a traditional alcoholic drink such as raki [anise-flavored alcoholic drink]. This loan will come in very handy to me and I’m very thankful to all the lenders in advance."

loans.use: to open a village bar and cafe.

loans.name: Yane De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Yane se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Damas del Futuro desde hace 3 años, en todo este tiempo ha establecido una muy buena amistad con todas sus amigas y compañeras del grupo. Viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde 1999, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Yane tiene 45 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 22 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo cursa los estudios universitarios y su segundo hijo está en el colegio. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en su propia unidad de taxi, la casa en la que vive es propia.

La Señora Yane se dedica desde hace 7 años  a la venta de productos de toperware (utensilios de cocina de plástico) y hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, sus productos los  venden de domingo a domingo. 

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos toperware y cosméticos para continuar creciendo en su negocio.

Su meta es viajar a Galápagos.
texts.en:
Yane has been a member of the communal bank "Damas del Futuro" for three years.  In this time she has established a very good friendship with her friends and colleagues in the group.  They live on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which is known for its architectual beauty.  Since 1999 it has been a World Heritage site and offers several places to enjoy nature and the kind, gentle people who maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Yane, 45, is married and has two children, ages 22 and 15.  Her eldest son studies at the university and her second is in junior high.  Her husband works as a taxi driver and has his own business.  They own the house they live in.

For seven years Yane has been selling Tupperware products, and for four years she has been selling cosmetics.  She works every day, Sunday to Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy Tupperware products and cosmetics to continue growing her business.

Her goal is to travel to the Galápagos Islands.

loans.use: To buy Tupperware products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en: Alina is from Ararat village where she lives with her family. Despite her young age, Alina has many years of experience in the agricultural field. She learned how to run a farm when she was a little girl. And now, she is married and helps her husband's family with the farming business. The family is big: Alina herself, her husband, sister-in-law, brother-in-law, and parents-in-law. Alina is also a mother of twin boys who are 3-years-old. The family's farm currently includes sheep, chickens, and turkeys. They cultivate tomato and grow apricot, apple, and pear trees. Alina and her mother-in-law take care of the farm by cultivating and raising different type of trees with great love and care, and the family's men sell the gathered harvest locally. As a result of their hard and tireless work, agriculture helps the family to have income and be able to sustain their living. Now, Alina with her hardworking family has applied for this loan in order to enlarge their farm. As this is Alina’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF.  The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who don’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The loan that Alina has requested will be used for purchasing fertilizer, which is very important for successful land cultivation. The loan will also cover fuel costs for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. Additional income would greatly assist this big family to cover their costs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer for the land cultivation and cover fuel costs for her farming business.

loans.name: Mukades

texts.en:
Mukades has been a potato producer/seller for the past 10 years. She is requesting a loan for the first time to buy goats.

“The potato business is beautiful and I like it," she says. "My potato produce is juicy and unlike others in the region. The size of the potatoes I produce is impressive and many buyers contact me every year to place their order. With the loan, I would like to buy some goats while I continue to operate my potato business." 

Mukades is very grateful for the opportunity to apply for a start-up loan with lower interest rates and admin fees. "Whatever money I generate from the goat business will go straight to my grandchildren's education savings,” she says.

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: Kafene Women Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with six children of whom three are still in school. She is in her second loan cycle. In her first cycle, she borrowed a loan of UGX 400,000, which she paid in four months. She has now borrowed a loan of UGX 600,000 to also be paid in four months. 

Beatrice has a retail shop and has borrowed money to buy more items to sell in her retail shop to meet the needs of her consumers. She is a member of Kafene Women’s Group located in the outskirts of the city. She hopes to borrow more money from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited so she can expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop and later buy a piece of land to live on with her family. 

Beatrice is a hardworking woman and thanks the Kiva lenders for taking an interest in their businesses and helping them access affordable loans. All the members that appear in the photograph have signed the waiver form, although some of them have rested from the loan and are saving. They have also consented to posting their picture on the internet.

loans.use: To buy retail stock.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is married and has five children. She stays at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. For the past four years, she has operated a water-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other water distributors. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a water tank for use in distributing water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for use in distributing water for sale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José é electricista e comerciante, tem 30 anos de idade  é casado tem 1 filho ainda menor e vive na casa de seus pais.
Ele faz prestação de serviço como electricista ao mesmo tempo fornece o material para instalacoa, tem um estabelecimento na sua casa de venda deste tipo de material.
Com o valor do emprestimo ira comprar blocos, ferro, cimento para dar continuidade  a sua obra um quarto no espaco que adiquiriu.
Sonhos terminar os estudos terminar os seus estudos esta no 2º ano do instituto industrial fazer a sua casa de sonho e montar um negocio no espaco adiquirido.
Diz que gosta de trabalhar coma a Hluvuku e gostaria de continuar este relacionamento para conseguir realizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
José is an electrician and merchant. He is 30 years old and married with a young son; he lives in his parents' home.
He offers his services as an electrician and also has a shop in his house where he sells electrical materials.
He will use this loan to buy cinder blocks, rebar, and cement to continue the construction a room in the space he acquired.
His dream is to finish his studies, as he he is currently in his second year of vocational school, and to build his dream home and set up a business in his space.
He says he likes working with Hluvuku and would like to continue the relationship in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, rebar, and cement to continue building an extra room.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. She has operated a shop business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of price fluctuation and stiff competition. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for resale in her general store.

loans.name: Geremias

texts.pt:
Senhor Geremias tem 29 anos de idade,casado e pai de um filho sem idade escolar,é negociante a mais de 2 anos,trabalha mais de 10 horas diárias,vive numa casa cedida.
Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar bebidas diversas,e carnes para abastecer o seu quiosque.ele adiquiriu um terreno, no futuro pretende construir casa própria para Acomodar melhor a sua família.
texts.en:
Geremias is 29 years old. He is married and has one school-aged son. He has had his own business for more than two years and works more than ten hours a day. He lives in subsidized housing.
He will use the money from the loan to buy a variety of soft drinks and meats to stock his shop. He has purchased a plot of land and plans to build his own house on it in the future to give his family a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and meats to stock his shop.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is a 44-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Jean Marie Vianney started selling lights in July 2012, and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Jacqueline, and their six children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is a 30-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Francois started selling lights in May 2012, and he has sold 130 lights to date, providing clean energy to 650 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Beatrice, and their three children (Jean Pierre, Olivier, and Olive).

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.pt:
A Senhora Argentina é viúva, tem 46 anos de idade, é mãe de 3 filhos, que frequentam o nível primário e secundário,é camponesa, trabalha mais de 12 horas diárias, vive na casa própria e sustenta seus filhos.
Com o dinheiro deste empréstimo vai comprar, blocos, areia, cimento para construção de uma dependécia.
Ela tem um outro terreno, no futuro pretende terminar a construção de uma dependécia ,que vai arrendar para adiquir receitas monetarias para incrementar no sustento dos filhos.
texts.en:
Argentina is a widow and is 46 years old. She has three children who are in primary and secondary school. She is a farm worker and works more than twelve hours a day. She lives in her own home and supports her children.
She will use this loan to buy cinder blocks, sand, and cement to build a rental property.
She has another plot of land where she plans to build a house to rent out and increase her income and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, sand, and cement to build a rental property.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is farmer with five years of experience running her farm. She lives in small village Dimitrov with her husband and two sons. Rima's farm currently includes 10 chickens and two pigs. The family also owns a plot of land where Rima grows apricot and apple trees with great care. As a result of the family's hard and tireless work, they are able to sell the gathered harvest to re-sellers and thereby provide a basic living condition for the family. Now, Rima with a great credit history behind her, needs financial support for improving her farm. She has applied for this loan to renovate her old greenhouse and cultivate more vegetables and fruits. She also plans to purchase two pigs and forage for feeding them. Rima hopes that this improvement will make her farm profitable, and she will be able to ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, two pigs, and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Hombres Del Campo Group

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo de estado civil unido de hecho, tiene 27 años de edad, curso 4 años de educación primaria, no tiene hijos, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, inició este negocio ayudando a su padre y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para la produccion de maíz como: semillas, fertilizante y pago de peones, desea en el futuro proximo tener más terreno para poder cultivarlo y cosechar en grande. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de maíz y papa.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, 27, lives in a common-law marriage and has no children. He studied four years of primary education. He grows corn, a business that started when he was helping his father. He has been doing it for seven years now and his wife helps him.

Reynaldo formed a group and is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizers and to pay for the labor. In the future, he wishes to have a bigger piece of land in order to expand his plantations and produce more.

The other members grow corn and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Coutinho

texts.pt: Senhor Coutinho é casado, e pai de 5 filhos que frequentam desde nível primário ao superior,tem 43 anos de idade,é estudante universitário, trabalha como militar durante 8 horas diarias,vive na casa cedida pelo governo.com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar vaso sanitário, cimento cola, e azuleijos para terminar o quarto de banho da sua casa própria que está em construção num outro terreno pertecente a ele.e terminar os estudos é seu maior desafio
texts.en: Coutinho is married and has five children in primary and secondary school. He is 43 years old and is a university student. He also works as a soldier eight hours a day. He lives in government-provided housing. He will use this loan to buy a toilet, grout, and tiles to finish the bathroom in his own home, which he is building on a piece of land he owns. His greatest goal is to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, grout, and tiles to finish his bathroom.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.pt: Senhor Bonifácio é casado e pai de 5 filhos, estudou até sétima classe, sustenta 3 filhos dos quais 2 por sinal são gémeos e frequentam nível médio de electrotecnia, trabalha mais de 12 horas diárias como ajudante num transporte semi-coletivo de passageiros,vive na casa própria com a sua família.Com o empréstimo vai comprar, barrotes, areia, cimento para dar continuidade a construção da sua moradia.No futuro pretende terminar a casa e colocar o mobiliario.segundo ele vai trabalharmuito mais e fazer empréstimo na hluvuku-adsema para realizar os seus projectos.
texts.en: Bonifácio is married and has five children. He attended school up till the seventh grade and supports three children, two of whom are twins and are studying to be electricians. He works more than twelve hours a day as an assistant on a bus. He lives in his own home with his family. He will use this loan to buy rafters, sand, and cement to continue the construction on his home. In the future he plans to finish and furnish his house. He says he will ork very hard and take out loans from Hluvuku-Adsema to carry out his projects.

loans.use: to buy rafters, sand, and cement to continue his construction.

loans.name: Genci

texts.en:
Genci has just opened up his little bar-restaurant in the village where he resides. He is now applying for a loan that will enable him to purchase necessary equipment for the restaurant.

Genci is 34 and single and his plans include getting married and having children soon. He is from a village of approximately 80 families in southeastern Albania.

Genci worked in Greece as a chef for a very long time and due to the economic difficulties there, he has come back now to his homeland to practice the skills he learned there.

loans.use: to buy necessary equipment for his village bar-restaurant.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 34 year old man from the Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of Thirty Thousand Rwandan Francs (RWF 30,000) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Martin started selling lights in September 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date providing clean energy to 100 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Jacqueline, and their 3 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Adrien

texts.en:
Adrien is a 36-year-old man from the Gicumbi district in the northern province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will sell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Adrien started selling lights in December, 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper, and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Laurence, and their four children.

loans.use: to buy ten low-cost LED lights to sell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Kabowa Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a widow aged 40 years with four children of whom three go to school. She is a resident of Kabowa church zone and a member Kabowa developmental group located in Kabowa. Her business is hair dressing and selling cosmetic products. However she also has another side income from rent where she gets money to pay school fees and also look after her extended family. 

She  has borrowed a loan of UGX 500,000 which she will use to buy equipment for her salon as well as  more cosmetic products. She is thankful to the institution for enabling them get money as low income earners.

The seventh person behind right is an Ugafode staff member.

loans.use: To buy salon cosmetics

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en:
Jean Nepo is a 41-year-old man from the Rulindo district in the northern province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will sell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Jean Nepo started selling lights in September, 2012 and he has sold 70 lights to date, providing clean energy to 350 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper, and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Dative, and their four children.

loans.use: to buy ten low cost LED lights to sell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio is a farmer looking to increase the economic viability of his farm while concurrently giving his children an example to follow in recognizing and reducing the environmental impact of the family trade. After installing their 12-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, the family will convert their animal waste into renewable biogas and biofertilizer, allowing them to reduce their GHG emissions as a result of displacing LP gas and agrochemical fertilizer, products derived from fossil-based sources. Additionally, reducing their dependence on these non-renewable inputs will result in significant financial savings. This loan represents 47% of the total value of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 12-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 40-year-old man from the Kayonza district in the eastern province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will sell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Elias started selling lights in March, 2012 and he has sold 90 lights to date, providing clean energy to 450 people. 

He is also a shopkeeper, and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy ten low-cost LED lights to sell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a widow and lives in Dicolic, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She had two adult children who live nearby with their own families. She owns and manages a shop offering multi-purpose repairs and maintenance of different types of vehicles and machinery. She has been doing this for many years to earn a living. 

In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC and recently is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to repair existing machinery for better service. She is very much hopeful to see an improvement in her business to enhance the living situation of her family.

loans.use: to repair existing machine

loans.name: Renie

texts.en: Renie lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez with his family. He is married with an only child. He owns and operates a service-based business providing motor transportation in their community to earn a living. His wife is a part-time teacher. For two years, Renie has been doing this work in order to augment their income and improve their living situation. Recently, he joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair his motorcycle and buy tires for it. He is hopeful to have a better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to repair motorcycle and buy tires

loans.name: Mark Khem

texts.en:
Mark Khem is a young entrepreneur, married with two children. He lives in Rizal, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental where he runs a wholesale and retail store selling dry goods. His wife is the one who takes care of his children and during her free time, is also able to help him in their store. 

He has been in this business for five years earning a better income to make a living. In 2011, he joined Gata Daku MPC and recently, he borrowed a loan to buy additional goods like plasticware and Ready-To-Wear garments. He plans to expand his business and is hopeful to have an improved living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like plasticware and Ready-To-Wear garments

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Uy, 32, is married and has three children. She lives with her spouse and children in a peaceful village of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. To make a living, she has been farming since she was single; she also sells fried meatballs and papaya salad. She is able to generate KHR 11,000 per day from her businesses.

She has applied for a loan to build a latrine; she will use the rest of funds to buy ingredients for selling fried meatballs and papaya salad. 

This loan will help her continue to improve her living status and business. Being a responsible mother, she hopes she can provide her children a comfortable life style as she strives to work hard.

loans.use: to build a latrine, and also use the rest of the funds to buy ingredients for selling fried meatballs and papaya salad.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is a married woman who has three children. Shiela is 30 years old, and resides at Tabo-o, Jimenez. Her husband is a contractual employee in a private company, while Shiela owns and operates a farm land, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been doing this business for four years, earning 7,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of 17,000 to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance. 

In the future, Shiela wants to make improvements to her house, and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and pay for weeding maintenance

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old and married. To make a living, Linda owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the market. Linda has been engaged in her business for years, and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Her husband worked in a private company being a chicken handler to earn for a living.

In 2010, Linda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Linda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
This is Rosanna, 32, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Cristito, a government employee, and they have children. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosanna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rosanna hopes to expand her business. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Turuhuke Ii Group

texts.fr:
Michel fait partie du groupe  Turuhuke II et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 50 ans et est marié à  Espérance, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 11 à 29 ans et tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de tuyaux PVC, les coudes,… depuis 25 ans.

Il est à son troisième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  tuyaux pvc, de coudes,…  à revendre  pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il  voudrait acheter une parcelle,construire une maison et voir ses enfants diplômés.
texts.en:
Michel is a member of the group called Turuhuke II and lives in Bujumbura. He is 50 and married to Espérance, a petty trader. Together they have seven children, ages 11 to 29, all studying. 

Michel sells PVC pipes and joints and has been doing this for 25 years. He is on his third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he obtains, he is going to grow his working capital and buy a lot of PVC pipes, joints, etc. for resale so that he can earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land, build a house, and see his children have diplomas.

loans.use: to buy a lot of PVC pipe and joints (elbows) for pipe for resale

loans.name: Rumar

texts.en: Rumar is a 22-year-old student at Misamis Institute of Technology studying Marine Engineering. His parents are farmers doing everything just to send him to school to have a better future. He also has a part-time job to earn extra income to support his personal needs. Despite these burdens, he never stopped, but rather became more eager to pursue his dream of finishing his studies. He plans to continue his part-time job while studying and hopes to find success in the near future.

loans.use: to finance his school tuition.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 33, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jeffrey and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Adelaida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Adelaida dreams of expanding her business and being able to go wholesale. She hopes to give her children a good life and education  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Munkhnasan

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhnasan, 42 years old, lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been teaching at the university for 12 years, and  is considered to be the best teacher by students. 

Her only daughter studies in America, and works part-time to cover the costs of living, but still needs financial help. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay for her daughter's tuition fee. 

She has high expectations for her daughter, and her dream is to see her daughter live a happy life; she thinks a good education is the main component of a happy life.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Erdene, 45 years old, lives with his wife, son and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional 'ger' (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been teaching drawing and mechanics at a high school since 2004. His wife has been making dresses for seven years at a tailoring factory and recently took her maternity leave. His son, 23 years old, studies at the national defense university. His daughter is studying at law school. His two-year-old daughter stays at home. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase felt, planks and metal in order to renovate his 'ger'. As a result, the family will be prepared against the coming harsh winter. More importantly, the family will reduce their coal consumption thus releasing fewer pollutants and contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is very hard-working individual who wants to improve his family's living standard.
