La señora Mirna de 28 años es casada, tiene un hijo quien ya estudia, su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte pesado, doña Mirna se dedica a la venta de ropa típica vende cortes, delantales, güipiles, fajas, blusas, suéteres, desde hace 3 años en el mercado municipal de Santiago, vende todos los días ya que algunas personas que venden ropa típica solo llegan cuando es día de mercado, anhela seguir ayudando a su esposo  económicamente y darle un futuro mejor a su hijo,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica para la venta.
texts.en:
Inspiration of Sacatepequez Solidarity Group

Sra. Mirna is 28 years old, married, and has a child who is in school.  Her husband works as a driver who transports heavy cargo.  Doña Mirna sells traditional clothing such as skirts, aprons, dresses, sashes, blouses, and sweaters.  She has been operating her business for the past three years at the municipal market in Santiago.  Mirna sells every day since some vendors only sell traditional clothes when it is their market day.  She wants to continue helping her husband with the finances so that they can provide a better future for their child.  

Mirna is requesting a loan so that she can buy traditional clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Fabiola Catalina

texts.es:
Fabiola catalina es una joven de 32 años de vive al norte de Estelí a unos 35 km al norte en la ciudad de condega, ella está felizmente casada, ella se desempeña como enfermera profesional y su esposo labora como conductor.
La señora Fabiola labora como enfermera en el centro de salud  de condega, ella tiene unos 4 años de laborar en dicho centro de manera continua, ella trabaja a diario de 7 de la mañana hasta la tarde y algunos días ella hace turnos corridos que incluyen todo el día y la noche para atender las emergencias que se presentan a diario.
Esta señora se presentó por primera vez a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento ya que ella piensa ayudarle a su hermano que cursa el último año de universidad a pagar los gastos del trámite del título de universidad ya que tiene un costo muy alto el cual ella no puede asumir por cuenta propia ya que sus ingresos mensuales no son los suficiente para poder costearlos de un solo.
Ella espera que la solicitud del crédito se le sea aprobado y de esta manera su hermano pueda obtener el título que lo acredite como profesional y así él pueda conseguirse un trabajo digno que le ayude al sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Fabiola Catalina, 32, is a young woman living in northern Estelí about 35 kilometers north of the city of Condega.  She’s happily married and works as a professional nurse; her husband works as a driver.

Fabiola works as a nurse in a health center in the municipality of Condega.  She’s been working there for about 4 years continuously.  She works every day from 7 in the morning until late and some days she works non-stop shifts that include all day and night to tend to emergencies that arise daily.

She came by the Ceprodel offices for the first time to request a loan because she plans to help her brother who is in his last year of university to pay for his university degree transactions which are very costly and he’s unable to cover entirely on his own because his monthly earnings are insufficient to cover all at once.

She hopes her loan request will be approved so that her brother can get the degree that will accredit him as a professional and he can get a good job that will help him support the family.

loans.use: to pay her brother's degree fees.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
This is Mary Rose, 37, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, a cook, and she is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Rose operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up  with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Mary Rose dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business but also in the education of her children as well as in their everyday household. Aside from her variety store, she also has a piggery for additional income. She and her  husband, who is a security guard, are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would now like to apply for a 17,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilou dreams of being more successful in her business and having more customers. She is hoping to give her children a good life and education. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina dries and sells fish to earn an income. She is grateful for her previous Kiva loan because it enabled her to achieve higher profits, which she used to pay school fees for her children and to improve her family's living standards.
 
She is requesting a new loan in the amount of KSH 20,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase different types of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

She thanks Yehu for offering access to micro-loans because they are significantly improving her business.

loans.use: o purchase different types of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti, aged 43 years, is married and has been blessed with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water and her largest monthly expense is on food.

She operates a food kiosk business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality on her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans, maize flour, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans, maize flour, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 21 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan with his family which consists of six members. Mohammad is currently studying toward Bachelor of Business Administration in third year.He is planning to work in his study field after graduation but he doesn't have enough money to pay his study fees. Now he is asking for a loan to pay for his summer semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his summer semester fees

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen, age 20, is a second-year Diploma of Accounting student. She lives in Mafraq with her family, which consists of five members.

Nisreen is planning to expand her studies by bridging to University, where she will pursue a Bachelor's degree. Due to financial hardship, she does not currently have enough money to pay for her tuition and other fees. For this reason, she requesting a loan in order to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her University tuition and fees

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 33 years old, married, and blessed with three children. He is a mechanic by training and he does panel beating. He has been in the business for more than ten years now. All his three children attend school. He also runs charcoal business in another market around town. His future goal is to be a distributor of spare parts in the whole city. 

Julius heard about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy fibre glass and chemicals. The challenges in the business include shortage of protective clothing and the high cost of transportation. The extra income raised from the business will help him improve his living standards and buy food and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy fibre glass and chemicals.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
The borrower, Shpresa, is 30 years old. She is married and raising six children in a Roma Community in Kosovo. Shpresa spends most of her time taking care of her children and her home, although she does help her husband with his woodcutting business. For more than 3 years, she and her husband have provided woodcutting services and supplied wood for heating in this community. Through his work, her husband helps his family and gives them everything they need, being able to provide everything with this income alone.  

Now Shpresa is requesting a loan in order to repair their saw, which has been in use for a very long time and in dire need of necessary repairs. She and her husband are very happy to have the possibility of getting a loan as they have the chance to improve their living conditions and have healthy food for their family. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To repair a saw for a woodcutting business

loans.name: Las Rayadas Group

texts.es: Las rayadas son un grupo solidario unido, que a continuado a pesar de muchos problemas, han sabido superar diferencias entre sus integrantes. Erika es una mujer trabajadora, tiene una estética y el crédito lo utilizará para invertir en materiales como tintes, cremas, etc. Ella vive en unión libre, junto con sus 3 hijos. Una meta que tiene Erika es terminar de pagar su camioneta y seguir creciendo en su negocio, en un local mas grande y mejor ubicado.
texts.en:
Las Rayadas is a supportive and united group that has kept on going in spite of many problems. They have had the wisdom to overcome differences among their members. 

Erika is a hard working woman, she owns a salon and she will use the loan to invest in supplies such as dyes, creams, etc. She lives in a common-law marriage with her 3 children. One of Erika's goals is to finish paying for her pick-up truck and to continue growing in her business in a bigger and better located establishment.

loans.use: to invest in cosmetic supplies.

loans.name: Union Y Amor 1 Group

texts.en:
Yris is part of the group named Union y Amor (Union and Love) 1. She is the representative of this group, and she has proven to be a very hardworking woman by doing different businesses to make extra income. This group is composed of five micro-entrepreneurs doing business in their rural community just outside of El Seibo. They sell meat, fruits and vegetables, clothes and other items. 

Yris is a mother and she lives with two of her children and her husband. She says that her most important challenge is to have good health because she wants to continue working. She still needs to help her family to make changes in her home structure in the coming year to live tranquilly in her older age. She enjoys sharing with her family and grandchildren. 

Yris runs a Grocery Store and she will uses this loan to invest by buying rice, flour, canned food, sugar, cooking oil, and other items. Yris and her group thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, canned food, sugar, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Dioni, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Fatoumata 2ème  femme assise à gauche vers la droite   dans la photo compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of this group called  Benkadi 1 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 37 and on average three children. They all live in the village of Dioni, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through their rainy season agricultural work, and through bonds of neighborhood, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet and rice. 

Wishing to buy tools, to purchase enough farm inputs, and to pay for day laborers to weed their fields, the members of the group found Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second seasonal loan. 

Madame Fatoumata, the second woman sitting from left to right in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Segou, to purchase tools made by local blacksmiths, and to pay young men to weed her field. She sells her agricultural produce for cash at the end of the rainy season to repay her loan and in order to have income to cover the needs of her children and part of those of the extended family.

loans.use: to buy tools, seeds and farm inputs, and pay for day laborers to weed the fields.

loans.name: La Buena Union 1 Group

texts.en:
Martha is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión 1 (The Good Union)” group. They are micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothing, shoes, crafts, etc. Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

Martha is a single mother of three children, two of whom still live with her. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been raising her children, although she enjoys caring for them and attending church. 

Martha is very excited about receiving her seventh loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward growing her business. She has had her business for about four years; she started it with her first Esperanza loan.

Martha will use this new loan to buy body lotion, deodorant, shampoo, hair conditioner and other cosmetics. She will use the profits to gradually build her house, since her dream is to live in peace with her children in a good house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy body lotion, deodorant, shampoo, hair conditioner and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Mikoroshini 1B Group

texts.en:
John, who is in his early 30s, is single with one daughter who is in school. For two years now, John has been running a food business selling chips. He works from 8 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a small return per month. John is working hard to see his family's life become better especially his daughter's. 

This is John's fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to buy new business chairs and repair his business place ('banda la chips'). With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, he managed to buy more business food items- Irish potatoes,meat and eggs which were used to make more chips. With the profit received from the business, he covered school fees and family expenses. John dreams that one day he will be able to own a big shop selling food items. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mikoroshini 1b" which consists of seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new business chairs and repair his business place.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So, age 56, is involved in a fish farming business. He owns a pond filled with fish that is not far from his house. When the fish are mature, So and his wife distribute them wholesale to local vendors at the local market, and they also sell the fish themselves at retail. So has been engaged in this business for two years. The business allows him to earn enough profit to support his family of four members. 

To help him stabilize his business, So needs a loan to buy more fish to raise in his pond. He offers his thanks to HKL and Kiva, the organizations that allow him to gain access to much-needed financial services. 

In the future, he hopes to improve his business and raise up his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish to raise in his pond

loans.name: Walace

texts.en:
This loan will help Walace grow his branding and merchandising company to supply personalized products for local entertainers and artists throughout the Greater Boston Area.

When Walace moved from Brazil to Boston, the one constant in his life was his passion for music. In 2001, Walace established his first business, ShowOff Marketing, a promotions company that worked directly with independent artists, musicians, and movie crews. Through this work, Walace learned about the specific marketing needs of local artists. It was this inspiration that prompted him to begin his new company, Merch-A-Lot, which creates professionally branded products and promotional materials for artists to sell to their audiences.

Walace is looking to expand his business and offer more products to his clients. This loan will help him purchase necessary materials and equipment for t-shirt screening and to create more professional branding images and to hire a part-time employee.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment and to hire a part-time employee

loans.name: Jéssica Amarilis

texts.es: La cliente vive en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó este negocio por recomendación de sus amigas, luego de la separación de su ex-conviviente.  Trabaja todos los días sola, dependiendo de los pedidos que le hagan y el sector que tiene que visitar.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijas, una mayor de edad y la otra de 13 años que estudia en el colegio fiscal.  Desea en un futuro poder tener su propio local en su casa.  Ahora desea invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de perfumes, bisutería y ropa para su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the city of Libertad. She started this business based on the recommendation of her friends. Afterwards, she separated from her ex-partner. The borrower works every day by herself. Her schedule depends on the orders she receives and the parts of town that she must visit.

The borrower is single and has two daughters. One is an adult and the other is a 13-year-old student at a state school. In the future, she wants to open her own store in her home. For now, she will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of perfumes, trinkets, and clothing for her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, trinkets, and clothing.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu appreciates the loan she received previously that enabled her to get profits that she used to pay school fees for her two children.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase dressing material, thread, and needles for her business.

She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva for the loan services that boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase dressing material, thread, and needles for her business.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 55 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs, such as sorghum, for resale. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy more sorghum for sale and to reinvest in the business for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a conservative woman, so she let her husband take her place in the picture. 

Khitam was born in 1967. She lives in a rented house in Amman, Jordan. Khitam has been working with her husband for five years in selling foodstuffs at her mini-market. One of the obstacles they faced is that they still didn't get a license for their mini-market. 

She is planning to expand her project by bringing more foodstuffs to her mini-market in order to increase her sales. Now she is seeking a loan to buy foodstuffs and products, which her customers are requesting and that are needed for Ramadan.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and products that are needed for Ramadan.

loans.name: Crystal

texts.en:
Crystal’s hobby and love for photography turned into a business for herself more than two years ago.  She financed the business with her own savings and began taking local contracts and jobs around the Baton Rouge area.

Crystal photographs weddings, birthdays and graduations all throughout the year and enjoys being part of each celebration.  One day, while visiting the Louisiana Small Business Development Center in Baton Rouge, she learned about Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit organization dedicated to helping entrepreneurs with financing options for their new or existing small businesses.  

After she inquired and applied with Accion, she was approved for a $5,450 loan and purchased lighting equipment, backdrops, editing software, seating props and tripods. Crystal will now be able to take on more contracts and special engagements, increase her income, and retain one full-time employee. Her next goal is to establish a website, but for now, she'll continue gaining referrals for future business through word of mouth.

loans.use: to purchase lighting equipment, backdrops, editing software, seating props and tripods.

loans.name: Kyle

texts.en:
Kyle lives in a rural area where he began a business cleaning equipment and water reclaiming systems for petrochemical businesses. When he began Ambassador Trucking & Commercial Services, LLC five years ago, there was only one other similar business – Kyle recognized the need and began his business.

The business began with investments from Kyle, his family, and friends. As the business expanded, Kyle returned to the nonprofit organization who aided him the first time he needed financial assistance. Again, Accion Texas Inc. loaned to Kyle to further help his community. With his $5,450 loan, Kyle purchased a van and water reclaiming system which allows him to save more water and secure more cleaning jobs.

Kyle says without the loan, he would not have been able to take on larger jobs, which would have decreased the amount of income received. He also sustained one full-time employee keeping his three-member team complete.

loans.use: to purchase a van and water reclaiming system, which allows him to save more water and secure more cleaning jobs.

loans.name: Lanisha

texts.en:
In her hometown of Birmingham, Alabama, Lanisha owns a lingerie and accessory business. For the last two years, she has operated Le Lingerie Closet alone selling product at lingerie expos.

Lanisha needed to purchase more inventory and to attend professional expos and trade shows, so after hearing about the nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc., she applied for a loan and received $5,450.

“Without this loan, I would not be able to participate in an industry expo,” she says. “This provides a tremendous amount of exposure to my business.”

Lanisha’s long-term goal is to have a storefront in the near future and to create jobs in her hometown.

loans.use: to attend professional expos and purchase inventory.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael lives in Mombasa Kenya. He is 27 years old, and he is not married yet. 

He carries people from one point to another using a three-wheeled vehicle commonly known as a “tuk-tuk”. He has been in this business for two years. His tuk-tuk broke and needs repair to take it back to the road. This is the only source of income for him. His long-term vision is to own a car-hire business. 

Raphael knew about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy spare parts and repair his tuk-tuk. The challenges in the business are competition, which is stiff, and the high cost of maintenance. The income raised from the business will go towards improving his living standard.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his tuk-tuk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, a sack of cabbages, and a sack of kale to offer for sale

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda was born in 1977. She is married and has three sons and two daughters. She lives in Zarqa, Jordan in a rented house. Aydas' husband is a bus driver, so their source of income does not cover their children's needs. For this reason, she has been working at sewing clothes for four years. She started her work at home by selling the sewn clothes that she makes to her neighbors and she is planning to expand her project in the future and to start selling clothes to people outside her area. 

Ayda is now seeking a loan to buy more fabrics and wool to be able to sew more clothes and raise her sales so that she will earn better income.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe    KOTOGNOGONTALA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  TANAKABOUGOU un des villages de la commune de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  
DIARRA  debout en première position de la droite vers la gauche fait le commerce de grains de maïs et de niébé.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ, 500 Kilos de grains de maïs et  50 Kilos de grains de niébé auprès des producteurs, qu’elle revendra en détail à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The five members of the Kotognogontala group are married women who on average are 45 years old with six children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Tanakabougou, one of the villages in the district of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are in their first group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to meet the needs of their customers.

Ms. Diarra, standing in first position from right to left, trades in corn and cowpeas.

She intends to use the loan to buy about 500 kg of corn kernels from producers and 50 kg of cowpea seeds, she will then resell for cash at retail prices in Sikasso and with her family to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects average monthly profits of 12,500 CFA francs, a portion of which is used to pay off the loan and its interest and the other put into savings.

loans.use: Pour acheter grain de niébé

loans.name: Bennie

texts.en:
This loan will help Bennie purchase the insurance she needs to expand her construction company.
As a young girl growing up in Pine Bluff, Arkansas, Bennie loved building and decorating beautiful doll houses. As she grew up, this passion never died. In June 2013, Bennie began her own company, Bennie Daye Services Inc., a home improvement and construction company based in Brooklyn, NY. Bennie hires contract workers who specialize in painting, drywall, plastering, kitchen and bathroom renovation, framing, flooring, and cleaning. Although she began her home-based business by serving residential areas, her business is quickly growing and Bennie is now ready to take on larger contracts with commercial businesses. 

Bennie hopes to grow her business to be one of the largest women-owned construction companies in the U.S. In order to continue to grow her business, Bennie needs to purchase materials needed to fulfill one of her first large commercial contracts. This loan will help Bennie buy the paint and construction supplies needed to grow her construction company.

Visit Bennie’s website to learn more: http://benniedaye.vpweb.com/

loans.use: to purchase insurance to service city and large commercial contracts.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old, married, and has three children who live with her. She is from Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter, and to support her daily needs, Alma runs a small eatery from her home. The foods are personally cooked by her, and each month she is able to earn an income of about PHP 8,000. In 2007, she joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. 

Alma has requested a loan of PHP 27,500, which she intends to use to purchase additional goods like rice, feeds, and canned and bottled products. 

She hopes to expand her business, which will allow her to earn more so she can live better in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like rice, feeds, and canned and bottled products.

loans.name: Las Sirenas Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es habitante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca o La  novia del  sol, la cual es una region ganadera. Ella es una de las nueve integrantes del grupo Las 

Sirenas.

Doña Carmen tiene la edad de 42 años, estudio solo la primaria y esta casada cone el señor esteban el cual es policía con el cual tiene dos hijos los cuales trabajan y 

ayudan con los gastos del hogar. 

Ella platica que como en estos tiempos la situación económica esta muy fea todos en casa tienen que trabajar para ganar el dinero y tener una mejor calidad de vida  , 

ella nos platica que inicio vendiendo oro pero como es muy caro no le dejo buenas ganancias a si que cambio e inicio a vender ropa y perfumes, ella vende casa por casa 

con sus amigos y vecinos. 
ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa (shorts, pantalones, blusas, camisas, playeras, calcetines, ropa interior)y perfumes para dama y caballero para 

su posterior venta. ella desea que con esta inversión las ganancias aumenten ya que desea que su hijo el mas pequeño regrese a la escuela y seguir invirtiendo porque 

espera que su negocio prospere.

los demás integrantes del grupo son:
josefina venta de ropa 
Consuelo venta de antojitos mexicanos
Veronica venta de comida y bolsas tejidas
Candelaria venta de ropa 
Maria Guadalupe venta de calzado 
Marisol venta de calzado
Dannay venta de calzado
Maria del carmen venta de zapatos
texts.en:
Carmen is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca [White Land] or La novia del sol [Bride of the sun], which is a ranching region.  She is one of the nine members of the group Las Sirenas [The Sirens]. 

Carmen is 42 years old and went only to primary school.  She is married to Esteban, who is a policeman and with whom she has two children, who work and help with household expenses.  She says that since in these times, the financial situation is very bad, everyone in the house has to work to earn money and have a better quality of life.  

She comments that she started out selling gold, but it didn't earn her good money, so she switched and started selling clothes and perfumes.  She sells door to door to her friends and neighbors.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of clothes (shorts, pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, socks, underwear) and perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, to subsequently sell.  With this investment, she hopes that her earnings will increase, because she would like her youngest son to go back to school.  She would also like to continue investing because she wants her business to thrive.

The other members of the group are:
Josefina - sells clothes
Consuela - sells Mexican snacks
Veronica - sells food and woven bags
Candelaria - sells clothes
Maria Guadalupe - sells footwear
Marisol - sells footwear
Dannay - sells footwear
Maria del Carmen - sells shoes

loans.use: to buy clothes (shorts, pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, socks, underwear) and perfumes.

loans.name: Gudelio

texts.en:
This loan will help Gudelio purchase a new tractor to increase his farm's productivity.

As a young man, Gudelio traveled every week to the central market in Mexico City and sold his family’s produce. He married,had four children, and continued to work on his family's farm. However, as his family grew, his income as a farmer in Mexico did not. Needing to provide for his family, Gudelio moved to New York City alone in 2001. Although he worked any job he could find for the first couple years in the States, his passion remained in the fields and he began looking for ways to tap into the farming market in New York State. Gudelio decided to invest his savings to lease a one-acre plot of land in Staten Island and he began cultivating what he knew: poblano peppers and herbs. Although this produce was uncommon in New York City, it was not unpopular. Gudelio wired most of his earnings to his family in Mexico. 

Now, years later, Gudelio leases multiple acres of land throughout New York, runs his own Community Shared Agriculture (CSA) program — El Poblano Farm (http://www.elpoblanofarm.com/), and supports his children who are now attending college in the States. 

The popularity of Gudelio’s produce is soaring, and he is looking for a loan to purchase a tractor to help him keep up with the demand.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Blanca Michelle

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás con la venta de velas e inciensos y le ha ido muy bien.  Luego emprendió con la venta de productos naturales de la línea Garden.  Trabaja todos los días, de 9 am a 8 pm.  Es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Le gustaría poder tener otro local en el centro comercial de la ciudad.  Ahora desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de velas aromáticas, pulseras y más productos naturales.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad. Some time ago, she began selling candles and incense and has done very well. Later on, she started selling merchandise from the Garden line of natural products.

The borrower works every day from 9:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. She is single and has no children. She would like to open another retail shop at a commercial center in the city. For now, she would like to invest this loan in the purchase of aromatic candles, bracelets, and more natural products.

loans.use: to buy aromatic candles, bracelets, and natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: comprar fertilizante organico

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad is a 46-year-old married woman with six children. Her husband is a laborer. It was very tough for to manage her household with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning and started buying cloths from the wholesale market to sell to the people of her community. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. In order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase a variety of cloths in different colors and designs, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend a part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cloths to sell.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed, age 50, runs a beauty parlor to earn an income. She has operated her business for the past two years. She began her enterprise because her husband's low income was not sufficient to sustain the needs of the family, and she applies her earnings toward providing the basic necessities for her children.
 
Over the two years that she has run her beauty parlor, Naheed has attained a growing list of regular customers. In order to meet their ongoing needs, she needs to buy larger quantities of hair care products, skin products, bleaching creams, and whitening agents. For this reason, she has applied for a loan in the amount of Rs. 35,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. 
 
Naheed is very experienced in her business and is confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of hair care products, skin products, bleaching creams, and whitening agents for her beauty salon

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a government officer. Suhair has been working st selling clothes that she gets from the free-zone market at wholesale prices for two years. She started her project at home. Then she expanded her project by opening her own clothes store. One of the obstacles that she is facing is lack of transportation. 

Now she is asking for a youth loan to buy new clothes and 'abayas' that are requested by customers during Ramadan in order to raise her sales and get good income to help her husband in covering their children's needs.

loans.use: To buy new clothes and 'abayas' that are requested by customers during Ramadan

loans.name: Lutf

texts.en:
Lutf is a 24-year-old, single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is innovative and full of ideas. He has been operating a phone accessories store that he started with a small amount of money. He works hard to accumulate money in order to increase his profit. 

Lutf applied for a youth loan of YER 150,000 from Al-Amal Microfiinance Bank (AMB) to buy a laptop for personal use. He looks forward to improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for personal use.

loans.name: Rodin

texts.fr: Rodin est homme de 28 ans, célibataire et père de 2 enfants. il possède et gère une boutique dans un quartier de la ville depuis 10 ans où il vend les vêtements. Dynamique et accueillant, il a vu sa clientèle croître au fil des années au point où il ne réussit pas toujours à tous les satisfaire. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des vêtements pour homme, femme et enfant afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ces profits. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son capital d'une part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part
texts.en: Rodin is a 28-year old man who is single with two children. He has owned an managed a shop in one of the town's districts for the past ten years and sells clothes there. Dynamic and welcoming, he has seen his clientele grow over the years to the point where he can not always satisfy them. He is requesting this loan to boost his stock of women's, men's, and children's clothing so that he can increase turnover and profits. The profits he generates will be used partly to reinvest in his business and partly to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's clothing for resale at his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group is comprised of three members who live in the same neighborhood, one of whom is Florence. She is 51, married and has two adult children. For six years, she has been selling diapers, ice, sachet water and kids' dresses for a living. She has been a client of the ID Ghana Institution since the inception of the Teshie branch. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy diapers, sachet water and kids' dresses to sell to customers. Florence is standing on the right hand side in the photograph. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva and fifth with ID Ghana. The previous loan has been successfully repaid without trouble, and she is deemed prudent to support. 

Other members include Rebecca and Rita.

loans.use: to buy diapers, sachet water and kids' dresses to sell to customers.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 43, lives with her husband and four children in Lahore. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for the past two years to support the family. 

At present, the rickshaw requires proper maintenance in order to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Razia has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 for her husband, who wants to buy a new auto rickshaw body. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband. She is confident that it will bring positive changes to his business and to the family.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw body

loans.name: Vida's Group

texts.en:
Vida, who is in 33 years, is married with two children who are in school. She is doing fine with her family. For six years now, Vida has been managing a small grocery store where she sells fruit drinks, coca-cola, biscuits and distilled bottled water. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be her fifth loan request from ID-Ghana. She will use the loan to restock her shop with more fruit drinks, coca-cola, biscuits and distilled bottled water and sell to her customers. Vida dreams that one day she will be able to open a big wholesale shop selling groceries. 

Vida is requesting a loan together with Richlove.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more fruit drinks, coca-cola, biscuits and distilled bottled water

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in a corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field.  

Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is the mother of eight children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy packs of sugar, biscuits, and tea to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of sugar, biscuits, and tea.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a married man who resides in Kashenyi cell rural- Ntungamo. He is a farmer who as well as having a banana plantation, also trades in goats. He has applied for ugx.1,500,000 to buy manure to apply to his banana plantation in order to increase his productivity and income. In the photograph is the loan officer with a tag and Alex with his wife(left to right.They are hard working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 46-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past ten years, has been running a business of clothing sales. 

Sakina buys clothing of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base, and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Sakina is requesting a 50,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Latifan's Group

texts.en:
Latifan is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband owns an electronics shop in which he offers televisions and LCD TVs on installment to his customers. He sells brands of TVs and LCD TVs such as Sony, Samsung, LG, Nobel and Panasonic. He also offers one year warranty for these electronics products. 

Her husband wants to grow his business and wants to offer more electronics to his customers but he does not have enough capital for investment.

Therefore, Latifan requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan,  a field partner of Kiva. Through this loan her husband will buy more electronics products to sell on installments. 

Latifan is very happy after taking this loan and very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: Latifan is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy televisions and LCDs to sell on installment.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.pt:
Victorino nasceu na Província de Inhambane, tem 39 anos, é casado e pai de 3 filhos. Responsabiliza-se também pela sua sogra que vive em sua casa.
É jardineiro há mais de 10 anos, com um salário mensal que aplica nas despesas da casa e da sua obra. Com este empréstimo, pretende adquirir material de construção, nomeadamente cimento, blocos e ferros para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku, os 4 anteriores foram também para a mesma finalidade pois tem vindo a construir a sua casa aos poucos.
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros empréstimos, porque o seu maior sonho é concluir a obra e conseguir também comprar alguma mobília.
texts.en:
Victorino comes from the province of Inhambane. He's 39 years old and married, and he has three children. He's also responsible for his mother-in-law who lives in his house.
He has been a gardener for over ten years and earns a monthly salary which he uses for his household and construction expenses. With this loan he intends to purchase construction supplies, namely cement, bricks and iron, so he can continue building his house. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku. The four previous loans were also for the same purpose, since he's been building his house little by little.
He's confident that he'll repay the loan ahead of schedule so he can apply for other loans, because his biggest dream is to finish construction and also buy some furniture.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies, namely cement, bricks and iron, so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto,  de 58 años de edad, casado del domicilio de Chinandega, se dedica a la compra y venta de leche, Jorge compra la leche a ganaderos de fincas, de esto elabora cuajada fresca, luego  sale de su casa de manera ambulante a vender estos productos, entregándolos en distintos negocios como: sorbeteria, pulperías, refresqueros y fritangas, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, para esto cuenta con un triciclo, que diariamente y desde muy temprano sale a vender estos productos. Jorge inicio su negocio vendiendo en su casa y luego empezó a ofrecer en pulperías, sorbeterias de manera ambulante. También se dedica a la crianza de cerdo en pie, los alimenta para engordarlos y luego venderlos. Jorge ha tenido varios créditos donde el manifiesta que su nivel y estilo de vida ha cambiado, también expresa que su casa ha mejorado su contextura, ya que antes todas sus paredes eran forradas con zin y hoy son de paredes de bloques, Jorge está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kivas, ya que le han dado la oportunidad de adquirir prestamos, para mejorar su vivienda e invertir en su negocio. Solicita financiamiento, para capital de trabajo, ya que necesita invertir más en su negocio, porque cada día es mayor la demanda de sus clientes por su producto.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto, 58, is married and from Chinandega.  He buys and sells milk for a living.  Jorge buys milk from dairy farmers and makes fresh curd.  He then sells his product door-to-door to specific businesses like ice cream shops, grocery stores, juice stands, and food stands.  He has long-term and casual clients.  He uses a tricycle cart to transport his product, and starts his day very early to sell his products.  He started his business selling from his home, and then later began offering his products to stores by going to door-to-door.  

Jorge also raises pigs, buying them young and selling them when they have grown.  

He has had several loans and he states that his quality of life has changed for the better.  He also states that he has been able to improve the structure of his house because before his walls were made of tin and now they are made of block.  

Jorge states that he is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva, as they have given him the opportunity to take out loans to improve his house and invest in his business.  He is requesting this loan to buy more ingredients for his product, because the demand from his clients has continued to increase.

loans.use: para invertir mas en capital de trabajo como: la leche

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith appreciates the previous Kiva loan that she got that enabled her to stock her vegetable stall.  In addition, she has a motorcycle business that is doing well, but has encountered a breakdown.

She is requesting a loan of Ksh.10,000 to purchase spare parts for her motor bike that needs to be fixed. 

She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the loan services that improve living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to fix her motor bike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and do maintenance work on his farm

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is 45 years old, a married lady, and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 which she will use to buy a stock of rice and sugar with packs of beverages from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice and sugar with packs of beverages

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in a corner of her house for a period of about one year. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills, and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is the mother of five children, and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy packs of biscuits, sweets, and grains from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. 

Rehana wishes to utilize part of revenue to deal with personal expenses, and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, sweets, and grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Simplifia

texts.en:
Simplifia is aged 30 years old and married with five children who are all school-going. He is responsible for their school fees payment. He is a peasant farmer mainly in maize and ground nuts, growing for both commercial and home consumption. Simplifia also trades in a local brew commonly known as waragi as an additional source of income for the family.

Simplifia wants a loan of 1,000,000 shillings to be used for agriculture, mainly by hiring labour to plough the farm in preparation for the next planting season and for buying seeds. He wants to grow more crops next season so that he is able to realize some good returns from the harvest.

However, he says that his major challenge is the changing seasonality as well as the price fluctuation on the market. But he is a hard-working person and would like the lenders to support him in his agriculture business.In the photograph is the client with the Ugafode credit officer at his homestead.

loans.use: To buy seeds and hire labour for ploughing the garden.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
John is 35 years old. He is a resident of Bunamwaya and member of God Is Able Group. He is married with four children who all attend school. Despite the fact that he earns little income, John has been able to take care of his siblings' needs in the village since his parents are too old to meet them.

John has been making bricks for many years. He has been very hard working and this has enabled him to purchase a motorcycle for himself to supplement his income. However, John  needs a loan to pay his siblings' fees to enable them to have a bright future.

John is a hard working, honest and cooperative member of society who is excited about the new partnership with Kiva through UGAFODE. He pledges to make his repayments on time and also urges other members to do the same.
In set is the group member composition though one of them has not yet taken the loan but they have all signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To pay tuition for his siblings.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 41-year-old married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials.  Over time, she has built a list of regular customers, and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Rehana needs to gain more customers all the time.  For this, she wants to buy packs of makeup kits, lipsticks, and cleansing products in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her third  loan cycle, with a good repayment history. 

She is very experienced in her business, and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy packs of makeup kits, lipsticks, and cleansing products in large quantities.

loans.name: Lucía Isabel

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con esta actividad ayudando a una amiga, luego vendiendo prendas a familiares y amigos.  Ahora ha crecido tanto que incluso viaja a realizar entrega de mercadería a otros pueblos.  Trabaja sola todos los días y su esposo trabaja independientemente.  Sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya están casados.  Desea poder seguir remodelando su vivienda y ayudándole a su esposo con los gastos familiares.  Por ahora necesita el préstamo para la compra de más ropa: camisetas, pantalones y sábanas para vender.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad. She started out in this line of work by helping one of her friends. Later on, she sold clothes to relatives and other friends. Now her business has grown to the point that she delivers her merchandise to other towns.

The borrower works alone every day and her husband works independently. Their children are grown and already married. She wants to continue the renovations to her home and to help her husband with the family expenses. For now, she needs a loan so that she can purchase more clothes such as T-shirts, trousers, as well as bed sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, trousers, and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam was born in 1973. She is married and has six daughters. Her husband is a government official. Ibtisam has been working at selling gifts and accessories for two years to earn good income to help her husband in covering their children's needs. She started her project with selling a small amount of souvenirs. 

She is planning to expand her project in the future, and she seeks to buy new merchandise for which she doesn't have enough money. Now she is requesting a loan to buy more souvenirs and accessories to raise her sales.

loans.use: To buy more souvenirs and accessories

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 31 years old, married with three children aged 7, 5 and 3 years old and all are going to school. He operates a business selling secondhand shoes in Kagadi town and at times he moves out to different markets to see that he gets more profits from the business than operating in one place.

Francis has approached Ugafode to get a loan of Ugx.1,000,000 (One million shillings) to buy more shoes for the business and be able to meet the demand. Francis always faces a challenge of transport when moving to different markets as well as the limited capital he has in the business.

Francis has a dream of buying a motorcycle to be used for transport whenever he is moving in the markets and also ensuring that he expands the retail shop in Kagadi to be operated by his spouse. He is a hardworking person and would like the lender to continue financially supporting him to have his dream come true.
In set is Francis at his shoes business that is still on a small scale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: La Cruz De Yerbateros Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  11  personas   emprendedoras y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “LA CRUZ DE YERBATEROS”. La Sra. Mariana  de 43 años de edad y con 2 hijos, la Sra. Mariana tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza  ya hace unos 5 años. La Sra. Mariana   ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes  el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos de belleza que va generando día a día ingresos para su hogar , y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos de belleza y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez la Sra. Mariana y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Mariana  se encuentra parada en el medio, se le distingue con una casaca de cuero de color negro, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The communal group “LA CRUZ DE YERBATEROS” is formed by 11 entrepreneurial members with a lot of creativity in business. Mariana is 43 years old and has two children. She has had a small business selling beauty products for five years. She has gathered a group of loyal customers, thus generating earnings to be able to cover her living expenses.

In the future she would like to have her own place where she may sell her beauty products, generating income for her home on a day-to-day basis and thus obtaining greater financial earnings. With the loan granted she will invest in buying more beauty products and thus keep satisfying her customers' needs in order to get ahead. 

Mariana and all of the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan granted and for the trust they have been given. Mariana is standing in the middle, distinguished by a brown leather jacket. She says good-bye with the promise that she will meet all of her set goals.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en:
Rasoolan, age 55, is a married woman and is successfully running a business of manufacturing rugs, with the support of her husband. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous in her circle for providing various designs of rugs. She is in charge of providing her family with bread and butter. She has improved her business gradually with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Because of her trust in this institution, Rasoolan requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers, etc. She is in her seventh loan cycle with a good repayment history. In this way, Rasoolan will be able to increase her sales and profits and to support her family well.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers, etc.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 46 years old, a vigorous, married woman, and a mother of five children. She has been in the work of hand-embroidery for the past seven years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is driving a rickshaw, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Rukhsana’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best-earning resource in her household. She needs to complete the orders of her customers on-time, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy spools of thread, along with packs of sequins and pearls in large quantities. The loan will help her to consistently meet the increasing demand of her customers. 

Rukhsana shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread, along with packs of sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Mikoroshini-1A Group

texts.en:
Rose, a single woman with a son who is in school, has been running a mamalishe business, offering food services and soft drinks for five years now. Rose, who is in her mid-30s, works from 5am to 10pm daily and is able to receive a good profit per month. 

This is Rose's tenth loan request with Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to start selling beers. With the previous loans, all of which she managed to pay back successfully, she bought food-cooking items, like some kilos of rice, meat, tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, and flour. She replaced the old business equipment, like a gas stove instead of charcoal, and she bought chairs, tables, a refrigerator, and a TV.  

The profit generated from her business will be used to cover more school fees and home expenses. Rose also started building a house. She dreams that, one day, she will be able to finish building her family house. 

Rose will share this loan with her loan group, Mikoroshini-1A Group, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling beers.

loans.name: Naylya

texts.ru: Найле 47 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей (2 дочери и 2 сына). Образование-среднее. Наиля с 1999 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 12,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход от хозяйства составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Найли, на сегодняшний день она имеет в хозяйстве: 3 дойных коровы, 5 овец. Также в наличии имеет земельную долю, размером 7,20 ГА, на которой она ежегодно сажает эспарцет и ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Найля обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с целью их откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Найля планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Naylya is 47 years old, married and has four children (two sons and two daughters).  She has a high school diploma.  Since 1999 she has worked in agriculture and with livestock, starting her business with 12,000 KGS.  Her monthly income from her farm is 7,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Naylya today has three dairy cows and five sheep.  She also has 7.2 hectares of land on which she plants sainfoin and barley each year.  With the goal of further developing her business, Naylya turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 55,000 to buy bulls to fatten and resale.  She plans to use the income from the loan to increase her herd.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a handicapped person who has not allowed her status to take advantage of her and has chosen to run a business so that she meets her needs and those of her family members. She is a third-time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd (MDI) applying for UGX 4,000,000/=. She is a married lady with five children that she looks after with the help of her husband. She operates a retail shop in the outskirts of the city for survival. Despite being disabled, she has always paid well the previous loans advanced to her.

She applied for the loan purposely to renovate part of her family house and also boost her retail shop by adding stock to it that is highly demanded by her customers. She has future plans of transforming her retail shop into a wholesale shop with the help the loans she borrows from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She also wants to see her family living well. She is hard-working.She thanks Ugafode for not being discriminative of people and serving them well.

loans.use: To renovate her family house.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: Nataly, de 24 años. Vive en compañía de su madre e hija en su casa propia.Durante las primeras horas del día se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos en un restaurante, ahí trabaja desde hace 2 años y observó el funcionamiento del negocio y aprendió mucho sobre la preparación de los alimentos y el gusto e exigencia de los comensales, es por esa razón que desea abrir su propio negocio. Por lo que se encuentra ahorrando lo necesario para comenzar este reto, ya tiene todo listo y espera completar el dinero restante con el apoyo financiero que espera recibir. Ahora se encuentra comprando los materiales que necesitaran y buscando un local en alquiler para abrir su propio restaurante. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Nataly invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para elaborar los alimentos tales como arroz, carnes y verduras.
texts.en:
Nataly is 24 years old. She lives with her mother and daughter in a house they own. During the early hours of the day she makes a living by making food at a restaurant. She has worked there for the last two years, observed the functioning of the business, and learned a lot about how to prepare food and about the tastes and demands of the customers. This is why she wants to open her own business and is saving what she needs to embark on this challenge. She already has everything ready and hopes to gather the remaining money with the financial support she is hoping to receive. Currently she is buying the materials that she will need and looking for a place to rent in order to open her own restaurant. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, which she thanks for the support received. She also promises to be punctual with her payments. Nataly will invest the 500 Peruvian nuevos soles in buying basic necessities to make her foods, such as rice, meats and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 17 и 14 лет. Мукаддас работает более 5 лет в мебельном магазине продавщицей. Ее муж работает сварщиком. Мукаддас упорно работает для того, чтобы зарабатывать больше денег для благополучия семьи. Ее старший сын в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Технический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Ее сын отлично учился в средней школе и успешно поступил в университет. Он умный и начитанный молодой человек. Мукаддас должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mukaddas is a hardworking woman.  She is married and raising two children, aged 17 and 14.  For more than five years, Mukaddas has worked in a furniture store as a saleswoman.  Her husband works as a welder.  Mukaddas works hard to earn a living to provide for her family.  Her older son finished high school this year and began his studies at Tajikistan Technical Institute of Technology.  Her son received top grades in school and was accepted into the school.  He is a smart and well-read young man.  Mukaaddas must pay for her son's tuition but doesn't have the money.  She is asking for a loan to pay the school fees.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s university education

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 59 años vive en compañía de su esposo Alejandro con quien tiene 9 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellas en su casa propia. Bertha se dedica a tejer lana. Ya tiene muchos años dedicándose a esta actividad económica por lo que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le realizan los pedidos, comenta que lo que más vende son gorras y chompas de lana, pues en las temporadas de invierno el frío es intenso. Ahora tiene muchos pedidos y desea comprar lana al por mayor para poder aprovechar el precio, obtener mayores ganancias y tejer sin dificultad pues siempre desea tener mercadería. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Bertha, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de lana al por mayor para la elaboración de los tejidos que realiza.
texts.en:
Bertha is 59 years old and lives with her husband, Alejandro, with whom she has nine children; however only two of them live at home. 

Bertha weaves wool for a living. She has spent years in this profession and has many clients who always place their orders with her. She tells us that woollen beanies and jumpers are what she sells most of since the cold is intense in winter. Right now she has a lot of orders pending, so she would like to buy wool in bulk to take advantage of the price. This way she can make a better profit and weave without difficulty, as she always likes to have merchandise on hand. 

This is Bertha’s first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she will receive. She also promises to be punctual in her repayments. Bertha will invest 500 soles in the purchase of wool in bulk to make her woven garments.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Felicita Del Carmen

texts.es: La cliente reside en el sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Tiempo atrás, la cliente necesitaba tener un ingreso para sustentar a su familia, por este motivo decidió montar su tienda.  Además esta actividad le permitía poder pasar más tiempo con su hijo pequeño.  Trabaja sola desde las 6:30 am hasta las 9 pm.  Es soltera, y su hijo ahora es mayor de edad.  Desea en un futuro incrementar aún más su negocio.  Necesita invertir el crédito en la compra de víveres para su tienda.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil. Some time ago, she needed to generate income to support her family. For this reason, she decided to open a store. In addition, this business allowed her to spend more time with her young child.

The borrower works alone from 6:30 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. She is single and her son is now an adult. In the future, she wants to increase her business even more. The borrower needs to invest this loan in the purchase of food products for her store.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Attia

texts.en:
Attia is 39 years old, a married woman, and the mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is Attia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. But, now, it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. 

For this reason, Attia has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband, who wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Attia is hopeful that this loan will be productive for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is a 40-year-old, married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for three years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But, due to low amounts of cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation in order to apply for her first loan. 

She needs a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams, in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers, time after time. With the help of the loan, she will be able to increase her earnings and hence can meet her household expenditures efficiently.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams, in large quantities.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is grateful for the previous loan she got from Yehu and Kiva that supported her in her clothing business and increased her profit margin.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase fabrics, needles, and thread for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their loan services that improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, needles, and thread for her business

loans.name: Kakindu Wome Development Group

texts.en: Prossy, the group treasurer, is 27 years old. She is a hard-working mother of one and takes care of ten other dependents, the majority of whom belong to her elder brother. She is a focused woman with a strong passion for business. She sells used clothing in the outskirts of the city. She thanks UGAFODE for providing loans to expand her business and taking good care of her family. Her dream is to expand her business to a large-scale one and build her own house to stop renting. She is hard-working and thanks Kiva for taking interest in their businesses, which has given them more zeal to work hard. The gentleman at the extreme right is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: to buy a stock of used clothing

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
At the age of 42, Mumtaz has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years to support her husband financially. She buys goats and cows at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

With a good repayment history Mumtaz, who has gradually improved her enterprise with the support of Kashf Foundation, is now requesting her fifth loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase another cow. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Swardana

texts.en:
Swardana is a 28-year-old woman who is married to Mus, 32 years old. They have three children from their marriage: Ariyanti, 12 years old, 1st grade of Junior High School; Nur Afifah, 6 years old, 1st year of Elementary School; and Rizki, 3 years old.  

Swardana is a housewife and her husband is a fisherman. Prior to having their own boat,  their monthly income was just enough to meet their family needs. If the weather is bad, Mus cannot go fishing, which means that he cannot produce any income. Recently, as the new school year comes, Swardana needs more money for the children’s schooling expenses. Therefore she went to TLM and asked for a loan amounting 4,500,000 IDR. Swardana is hoping that the loan assistance from TLM will enable her in providing a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay her children’s schooling expenses

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, 35, is married and a mother of six children. She has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price. For this reason, she has many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough money to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she is requesting a RS 35,000 loan to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. This will allow her to consistently meet the increasing demand for the products. She will utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour to sell at her store

loans.name: Zakarias

texts.en:
Zakarias, 38, is married to Yetti, 34. They are blessed with one daughter, Yetty. Yetty is ten years old and is currently in fourth grade.

Zakarias has been a farmer for years. The job allows him to earn income to finance his household's needs. He cultivates a paddy during the rainy season and grows vegetables, such as corn, tomatoes, and cucumbers, in the summer. 

Zakarias plans to plant more vegetables but needs additional money to buy seedlings and fertilizer. He also dreams of starting a poultry business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM for IDR 10,000,000. This loan would enable him to build chicken stalls as well as buy two boxes of chicks and fodder. Zakarias is hoping that TLM will provide him with a loan so he can improve his business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, chicks, fodder, and chicken wire

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah was born in 1962. She is married and has six children. Her husband is retired. She has been selling clothes at her own store since having her third child. 

She started her business at home, then opened her own store to raise her profits and help cover her children’s needs. 

With this loan, she will buy new clothes to sell. She plans to add products in the future.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Michael Gonzalo

texts.es: El joven Michael, de 29 años de edad es soltero estudiante de la carrera de Ing. Civil, trabaja como técnico para una institución estatal, medio con el que se apoya para pagar sus estudios universitarios, los cuales está por culminar y para tal fin solicita el crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación, por el que tiene mucha ilusión para verse como todo un profesional y salir adelante en la vida con sus esfuerzos, para ayudar a los demas dentro de sus posibilidades.
texts.en: The young man Michael is a 29-year-old, single student who studies Civil Engineering.  He works as a technician for a state institution. This is the means by which he pays for his education, which he is about to complete. For this reason he requests a loan to pay for his completion course.
