They know each other through their seasonal agricultural work, as well as through being neighbors or relatives by blood or marriage. They grow peanuts, millet and rice. With the goal of buying small tools, stocking up on agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc]  and paying the cost of labor for weeding their fields, the group members have found Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second agricultural cycle loan. Mrs. Bintou, the one seated with a bowl on her head in the photo, is well known as a farmer in the Moussabougou village. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and agricultural inputs in Segou, small tools from local ironmongers and to pay young people to weed her field.  At the end of the rainy season, her produce will be sold for cash so as to repay her loan and provide for her children’s needs and some of her household needs.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds and agricultural inputs as well as pay for the labor costs of weeding.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey, a 28-year-old single man who describes himself as focused, has operated a retail shop selling foodstuffs for the past two years. Located in an area suitable for business, his primary customers are small-scale business people. He also does poultry farming to earn extra income.

With his biggest challenge a shortage of funds to buy stock, Geofrrey has requested his first loan of Kes 20,000 loan with SMEP DTM to buy more sugar, bread, cooking oil and other foodstuffs. He hopes to be a large scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: buy a stock of sugar, bread, cooking oil and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 52-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 20 to 26 years. She describes herself to be hopeful. She operates a poultry farm where she sells hens. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are farmers. 

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy hens for resale. Her business goal is to expand her  business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy hens for resale

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 30 months to 8 years. He describes himself to be determined and strong. He operates a bicycle transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle from one place to another. He has been involved in this business for five years. 

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more bicycles for hire. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be wealthy. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles for hire

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 1 year to 10 years. She describes herself to be self-motivated and visionary. She operates a butchery where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with many clients. 

Mary describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of storage facilities. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of meat for resale. Her business goal is to open new branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a piece of land and a vehicle for transporting meat. Previously, she was involved in selling clothes.

loans.use: to add to her stock of meat for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 29-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand her business. 

Grace will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more clothes for resale. Her business goal is to have a stable shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big clothes shop and will be able to support her family comfortably. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 57-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, and sweet potatoes and keeps cows that produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in an area that has many potential customers and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to expand. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer, feed and other items. Her business goal is to be a major farm products supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will able to provide her family with all the basic needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer, feed and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of bananas, tomatoes, oranges, kale and other items for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 60-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages 11 years and 34 years. She describes herself as independent. 

She operates a food stall where she sells potato chips. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are of all types. 
She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds to expand. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more potatoes, cooking oil, wheat flour, etc., to expand business. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be supportive to her family.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, cooking oil, wheat flour, etc., to expand business.

loans.name: Zawelia

texts.en:
Zawelia is a 66-year-old woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 20 years to 40 years. She describes herself as committed to her obligation. 

She operates a farm where she she grows sweet potatoes, bananas, maize and beans to sell. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fertile place for farming and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as poor infrastructure. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers, etc. Her business goal is to be a major supplier of farm products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she gets a better income and provides her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of oranges, bananas, watermelons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of oranges, bananas, pumpkins, etc.

loans.name: Kaunda

texts.en:
Kaunda is a 38-year-old man. He has two children. He describes himself as faithful. 

He operates a transport service business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of capital to expand his business. 

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another motorbike. His business goal is to have a public service vehicle within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman who describes herself as determined. For the past three years, she has operated a chemists where she sells different types of medicine. Lucy's primary customers are students and lecturers. Her biggest business challenge is the lack of funds to expand her business. 

Lucy is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to add stock of medicine to resell.

loans.use: to buy medicine to resell

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a carpentry business where he makes chairs, beds, stools, and tables for sale.  He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an  area that is good for business and his primary customers are small-scale.

Erick describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of materials for making furniture. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy timber, nails and other furniture-making materials. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other furniture-making materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies (guadua wood and plastic) to widen the greenhouse.

loans.name: Juán Miguel

texts.es: Juan Miguel, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hija los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una buena semilla que se adapte bien a la zona y fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel is 21 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and daughter, and they are his greatest priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy good seeds that adapt well to the area.  He will also buy fertilizers and other products to use at planting time.  This way there will be good germination.  Additionally, he will pay for the labor to apply the products and for caring for the plants once they start growing.  This way he will be sure to do a good job.  He intends to take advantage, for this crop, of the good climate and soil conditions in the area.  He will also put into practice his several years of experience in managing basic crops.

He will also be able to buy the best products and better quality so that his plants grow well and so that they are healthy.  He will have an adequate harvest, and in the short term, and important production.  He wants to use the income from the harvest that he hopes to get for his family’s well-being, his family’s education, for some family goals, and to continue investing more in the crops.

It is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not previously had other loans with state banks.  However, FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
43-year-old Marie from Liberia lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms, filthy conditions, and due to being over-populated, but the interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper. Interestingly, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, which leads to lower prices for food. 

Marie is married with two children aged 14 and 8, who are in school and live at home. Over the past 17 years she has been operating a table business. She started this business with money from her mother and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans is to move from table business to shop.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Salamatu from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children, 13 years and 20 years old. Her children are attending school. She started business because she wants to generate income to support her needs.

Salamatu runs a local cooked food business; she sells cake and fried chicken. She has been running this business for over seven years. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 7 days per week. Salamatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to purchase foods including flour, ketchup, cooking seasonings and soft drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her capital and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase foods including flour, ketchup, cooking seasonings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Tumba

texts.en:
Tumba is 33 years old and married. She has four children between the ages of 8 years and 15 years. 

She runs a plastic slippers business in Jui eastern area in Freetown. She started business because she wants to improve her standard of living. 

She's been in this business for five years and sells plastic slippers around her community. She says her major hardship is that during rainy season sales are very slow.  

Tumba requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase plastic slippers to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to change her business to a clothing business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase plastic slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Agesha

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Agesha from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is single with no children.  

For the past three years, Agesha has been establishing her provision business. She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 11 house per day and six days per week. She says that her business is doing well because out of the profit she is able to develop herself and provid food for her parents.

Agesha requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuit sand sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Agesha, plans to become a big business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mariama from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 25 years old.  For over 10 years, Mariam has had her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and expand her business. In the future Mariama plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Fatmata, from Jui, an eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is widowed, with three children between the ages of 5 and 18 years. 

For the past ten years, Fatmata has established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and proper storage for her drugs.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more pain tablets, cholera drugs, and malarial drugs for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big pharmacy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pain tablets, cholera drugs, and malarial drugs for resale.

loans.name: Zainab     S

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Zainab from Jui, an eastern area in Freetown. She is single, with three children between the ages of 5 and 14 years. She has three additional dependents living with her because they are relatives from the village.

Zainab runs an ice cream business. She sells ice cream within the community. She has been running this business for 12 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of sufficient capital to run his business.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to purchase bags of milk and sugar to prepare her ice cream products. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and buy a generator to cool her business. In the future, she plans to open an ice cream shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of milk and sugar to prepare her ice cream products.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mariatu from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 years and 18 years.  

For the past 10 years, Mariatu has been establishing her garden alongside a retail business. She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 house per day and six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to expand her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase milk, biscuits and sugar, and farm supplies to expand her garden. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk, biscuits and sugar, and farm supplies to expand her garden.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 43 years old and married with 2 children between the ages of 8 years and 21 years. She runs a clothing business in 
Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She started her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. 

Mabinty has been in this business for over 15 years and sells clothing material within a busy market area. She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing material to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to expand her business more. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material to expand her business

loans.name: Sallor

texts.en:
This is 48 year-old Sallor who is married with five children between the ages of 15 and 28. She is from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. For the past 20 years, Sallor has been running a palm oil business in a busy market area. She works12 hours per day, six days per week. Sallor's main business challenge is her lack of capital to run her business. 

Sallor is requesting a loan to purchase more local food stuff like palm oil and gari, which is made from cassava. She will use the extra income from her loan to improve her living standards and repay her loan. In the future, Sallor plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and gari

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Rugiatu from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 11 and 24 years old.  For the past 10 years, Rugaitu has had her foodstuffs business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and transportation cost.

Rugaitu requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and expand her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to open a food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, milk, biscuits and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Memunatu from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 7 years and 22 years. For the past 18 years, Memunatu has established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 11 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuations and transportation costs.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Memunatu hopes to become an agent of fish. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
For over four years, Daniel has been running a business of sending and receiving money in his hometown of Livingstone. He is 31 years old, married and has one child. 

Daniel used to run an internet café with his mobile money transfer business, but then the landlord tripled his rent and he was forced to close the cafe. Since he no longer has a shop, he is now renting a Zoona trading booth to run his mobile money transfer business. Daniel now wholly relies on the profits from his money transfer business to earn his living. 

With the Kiva loan that he is requesting, Daniel would like to purchase his trading booth and increase his working capital float so that he serve even more customers and grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: To purchase his Zoona trading booth, currently leased to him and increase his working capital to grow his money transfer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spices to sell.

loans.name: Estrellitas De Magisterio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS DE MAGISTERIO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Josefina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verdura, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, trenzado de mantas, costura de polleras, venta de frutas, venta de chicharron (comida boliviana).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Josefina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeras del grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chicharron (comida boliviana); cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace siete años, al observar la posibilidad que tenía en la zona para vender este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne de cerdo) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ESTRELLITAS DE MAGISTERIO” is beginning its second cycle with the field partner through the field partner’s Santiago II regional office. This group is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Josefina is the president. The businesses of the members are varied and include vegetable sales, a corner store, knitting sweaters, blanket weaving, sewing of skirts, fruit sales and sales of chicharrón (a Bolivian dish made of pork).

The loan will be used in some small businesses of which Josefina is a member. She became a member of the field partner one year ago at the invitation of some members of the group. Josefina currently has a business selling chicharrón. She says that she learned this business seven years ago, when she noticed the possibility of selling this product in her area.

Josefina will use this loan to increase the capital of her business by buying pork from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. She will use the pork to make chicharrón and sell it in her area. She says that this business allows her to earn income to pay for as many of her household expenses as possible. She lives with her partner and has four children.

Asked what she likes about the field partner, Josefina says that she likes the training programs on credit and on health.

loans.use: to buy pork.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад женатый молодой человек в возрасте 27 лет. Он живет с женой, двумя сыновьямм и родителями в районе Мастчох города Худжанд. Сыновьям Ахмада - одному 4 года и второму 1 год. Ахмад зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь животноводством и сельским хозяйством. Ему помогает жена и отец. Ахмад в течение 5 лет закупает, откармливает и перепродает крупнорогатый скот. Одновременно он на 1,5 га участке орошаемой земли занимается выращиванием земляного ореха. Ахмад очень трудолюбивый человек и трудится каждый день, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Сейчас в хозяйстве Ахмада имеется одна дойная корова и один бык. Он просит кредит, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Он хочет купить двух коров и жмых и таким образом продолжить деятельность.
texts.en:
Ahmad is a married man of the age of 27. He lives with his wife, two sons and parents in the city of Khujand, in the Mastchoh region. Ahmad's sons are four and one years old. 

Ahmad earns a living through working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. He helps his wife and his father. Ahmad has for a period of five years purchased, fattened and resold cattle. At the same time he grows peanuts on 1.5 hectares of irrigated land. Ahmad is a hardworking man and strives hard every day to support his family. Currently Ahmad has one dairy cow and one bull at his farm.

Ahmad requests a loan in order to increase the number of cattle. He would like to purchase two cows and fodder and this way keep up his business.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of cattle and feed to keep up his business

loans.name: Juliana Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Juliana es una señora de 59 años, soltera, que habita en el municipio de El Sauce, se gana la vida trabajando como comerciante donde ofrece ropa usada para adultos y niños.
Inició su negocio hace cuatro años con capital de su liquidación cuando salió de laborar como conserje de una empresa en la misma localidad.
Sale desde las cinco de la mañana a ofrecer de manera ambulante a las diferentes comarcas aledañas lo que es la ropa usada que por lo general por ser barata la adquieren los pobladores de escasos recursos.
Debido a la gran demanda que tiene de sus clientes y por no contar con suficiente capital doña Juliana está solicitando el apoyo a los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel para que le otorguen un crédito con el cual comprará una paca de ropa de niño y una paca de ropa para adulto.
Confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyarán su solicitud ya que ella es de escasos recursos y necesita de esta mano amiga.
texts.en:
Juliana is a 59 year old single woman who lives in the municipality of El Sauce.  She earns a living selling used clothing for adults and children.

She began her business 4 years ago, with the settlement capital from when she left work as a janitor.  She had worked for a business in the same locality.

She leaves at 5 in the morning to walk to the different surrounding districts and offer used clothing.  The clothing is generally inexpensive, so the residents can acquire it. 

Due to the high demand she has from their customers, and for not having enough capital, Juliana is requesting the support of Kiva and investors through Ceprodel to grant her a loan to buy a bundle of children's clothes and a bundle of adult clothing.

She trusts in God that good-hearted people will support her request because she is poor and needs a helping hand.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothing for children and a bundle for adults

loans.name: Nasy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nasy es originaria de la bella ciudad de Matagalpa conocida como la perla del septentrión ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua, estado civil casada y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar. 

Su profesión es cajera de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace 22 años su salario devengado lo destina para el gasto del hogar y los estudios de sus tres hijos que están cursando la secundaria. Nasy es una persona trabajadora responsable y honesta ya son tres crédito que ha trabajado con CEPRODEL y manifiesta que han sido de gran importancia porque ha realizado mejora en su vivienda.

Con el financiamiento otorgado lo va destinar para la 
Compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc 12 lamina, 18 perlines y 16metros de cerámica ya que necesita realizar mejora en su vivienda. Manifiesta sentirse alegre por el apoyo brindado por Kiva ya que de esta manera puede mejorar su vivienda y darle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nasy is originally from the beautiful city of Matagalpa, known as the pearl of the north, located on the northern part of Nicaragua.  She is in a civil union and has three school-age children.

Her profession is the cashier for a water service and sewage company and she has worked there for 22 years.  Her salary has been earned as she intended, to support household expenses and pay for the studies of her three children in high school.  Nasy is a person who works responsibly and honestly, and this is her third loan working with CEPRODEL.  She states that they have been very important because they have improved her housing.  

She will use this loan to buy construction materials like  zinc 12 laminated, 18 perlines and 16 meters of ceramics, which she needs to improve her home.  She says that she feels happy for the support provided by Kiva, because in this way she can better her home and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like  zinc 12 laminated, 18 perlines and 16 meters of ceramics.

loans.name: Muhammadrofe

texts.ru: Мухаммадрофе молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 19 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Ее мама Зинатгул занимается бизнесом. Мухаммадрофе окончил Таджикско-русскую гимназию. Он успешно учился в средней школе и получал отличные оценки. Он упорно учил такие предметы как русский язык, английский язык, географию и математику. Мухаммадрофе поступил в университет и должен оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Muhammadrofe is a young and energetic man. He is 19 years old. He is not married, and lives with his parents. His mother, Zinatgul, is engaged in business.

Muhammadrofe graduated from a Tajik-Russian high school. He studied successfully in high school and received excellent grades. He studied subjects like Russian language, English language, geography and mathematic persistently. Muhammadrofe started university and needs to pay his tuition. He requests a loan to pay this tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо 19 лет. Она умная и успешная студентка. Мархабо учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете в факультет География и экология. Она учится на 2 курсе. Мархабо является одной из успешных студентов. Она помогает своим однокурсникам, которые нуждаются в помощи. Ее однокурсники любят и уважают ее. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marhabo is 19 years old. She is a smart and successful student. Marhabo studies at the Khujand State University, at the department of geography and ecology. She is in her second year. 

Marhabo is one of the best students. She helps any classmate who needs it. Her classmates love and respect her. She needs to pay for her tuition, but does not have money for it. She requests a loan to pay the tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa es una señora de 43 años, soltera, originaria del municipio de El Sauce ubicado entre montañas y ríos caudalosos, se siente muy orgullosa de vivir en este poblado maravilloso donde sus habitantes se caracterizan por su amabilidad y hospitalidad.
Estudió la carrera se secretariado y actualmente se desempeña como tal en una empresa de la localidad donde tiene más de veinte años de brindar su servicio.
Hace algunos meses accidentalmente se cayó en el transcurso para el trabajo y se fracturó el tobillo por lo que ha incurrido en una serie de gastos, por tal motivo se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel con el fin de obtener un crédito para  realización de placas, pago de consultas médicas y compra de medicina para mejorar la fractura y así poder rendir en su trabajo.
Se siente muy agradecida por la atención que le ha brindado Ceprodel y los inversionistas de Kiva, ya que le han otorgado los créditos en el tiempo que más los ha necesitado.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 43 years old, she is single, and she is originally from the El Sauce area, which is located between mountains and flowing rivers.  She is very proud to live in this wonderful town where people are characterized by their friendliness and hospitality.

She studied for a career as a secretary and she has worked as a secretary in a local company for more than 20 years.

A few months ago she accidentally fell on the way to work and broke her ankle. Because of the accident, she has incurred a series of expenses. She came to the Ceprodel office to ask for a loan so that she can buy a cast, pay for medical consultations, and buy the medicine she needs in order to heal her ankle and be able to go back to work.

She is very thankful for the help that Ceprodel has provided to her and to the Kiva lenders, as they are giving her help at a time that she needs it most.

loans.use: to pay for a cast, pay for medical consultations, and to buy medicine.

loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Dim is 47 years old. She has a common-law relationship and has seven children. She lives with her spouse and children in Tuek Phos, which is part of Kampong Chhnang province, about 91 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Many people living in the area, including Dim’s family, rely on income generated from agricultural business because the land is irrigated by the Tonle Sap, a tributary of the Mekong River. Dim has been doing farming for more than 20 years and earns a net profit of KHR 33,300 per day.

Dim would like to borrow a loan to renovate her old house. With the loan, she will be able to buy supplies needed for the construction, such as house columns and wood. Through this loan, she can achieve her dream of having a suitable house for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed for her house renovation, such as house columns and wood.

loans.name: Muyasara

texts.ru: Муясара добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 41 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Ее муж работает в государственной организации. Муясара работает в средней школе. Она преподает историю. Она работает более 24 лет в сфере образования. Муясара всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. В этом году ее старший ребенок окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Она была очень рада, когда ее ребенок успешно сдал экзамены. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор в университет, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1300 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muyasara is a good and hardworking woman. She is 41 years old. She is married and raising five children. Her children are not yet grown-ups. Her husband works in a state organization. Muyasara works at a high school. She teaches history. She has worked in education for more than 24 years. 

Muyasara always dreamed that her children would receive higher education. This year her eldest child finished high school and started university. She was very happy when her child passed the exams successfully. Muyasara needs to pay for the tuition at the university, but does not have money. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,300 US dollar. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s tuition at the university

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es: Cesarea nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 44 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella es profesora y trabaja en un colegio de la ciudad de Paucartambo pero en sus horas libres también ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y regalos, ella una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, collares, aretes, pinta labios, desodorantes, ropa y otras cosas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Cesarea was born in the city of Paucartambo, and lives in the same city.  She is 44 years old, and is in a common-law marriage that has produced a child.  She is a hardworking and enterprising person who is supporting her family with her efforts at her work.  She is a teacher who works in a school in the city of Paucartambo, but in her free time she also sells cosmetics and gifts.  She is a responsible person, and this is why she was invited to participate in the communal bank “Señor de Coyllority."  At this time, she needs a loan to buy merchandise, for example: perfumes, necklaces, earrings, lipstick, deodorants, clothing, and other items.  She appreciates and values this loan, and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, necklaces, earrings, lipstick, deodorants, clothing, and other items.

loans.name: Hamidullo

texts.ru: Хамидулло 24 года. Он не женат. Хамидулло трудолюбивый, честный и добросовестный человек. После окончания средней школы, он поступил в Современный Государственный Университет. Он окончил университет по специальности экономиста. После окончания университета он не смог найти подходящею работу и уехал в Российскую Федерацию. Там он работал разнорабочим. Судьба привела его в город Москву. Там он поступил в МГТУГА. Он одновременно и учился и работал. Для него это было трудно, так как он юноша из отдаленной сельской местности. Благодаря упорству он пережил все трудности и сдал все экзамены отлично и хорошо. Данное время он является студентом 2 курса. Он приехал на каникулы в свой кишлак. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Hamidullo is 24 years old. He is not married. Hamidullo is a hardworking, honest and conscientious man. After finishing high school, he entered the Modern State University. He finished university with a specialization in Economy. 

After finishing university he was not able to find appropriate work, and he went to the Russian Federation. There he worked as a handyman. Fate brought him to Moscow. There he entered the Moscow State University of Civil Aviation. He worked and studied at the same time. It was hard for him, as he is a young man from a remote rural area. Thanks to his persistence he endured all difficulties and passed all exams. Currently he is a second year student. He went on vacation to his village (kishlak). 

Hamidullo requests a loan in the amount of 6,000 US dollar to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition at the university

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig-fattening. Bernadette is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Bernadette has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Arlene successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to build her general store business.

NWTF is re-listing Arlene's business profile again, in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.
